NAME: qeunconm
DEFINITION: Q (capital costs-to-output ratio) in unconventional energy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Capital output ratio for unconventional energy multiplier.  A multiplier on all types of energy capital output, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the amount of capital required per unit of energy output and lower values decrease it. Lower this parameter gradually over time to simulate a decreased cost of an energy form (such as renewable energy) as a result of technological advance.  Raise it over time to simulate the addition to the capital cost of an energy form (say nuclear) as a result of the addition to those costs of environmental ones.

NAME: QEUNCON
DEFINITION: Q (capital costs-to-output ratio), unconventional
Parameter Explanation: Capital output ratio for unconventional energy, in dollars, per barrel of production capacity, by region and energy category.  This variable determines how many dollars of capital are required in the production of a barrel of oil equivalent in each energy category.  It therefore represents the cost of energy production.  QEUNCON is exogenous only for nuclear and renewable energy.  Values for oil, gas, and coal are computed endogenously (and depend on remaining resources) and should be examined only as indicators.  To change the cost pattern for those energy forms, use resorm and increase or decrease resources.  Values for renewable and nuclear energy can be exogenously changed, but you should maintain the initial value of the base case.  A series of gradually lower costs could represent technological progress (e.g. in the solar component of renewable).  A series of gradually higher costs could represent the impact of environmental factors (e.g. increasing costs of nuclear waste disposal).  Higher or lower values will increase or decrease investment in a particular energy category and will affect its production level.  You should be aware that investment will respond only to changes over time in QE and not to changes in the initial condition.

DEFINITION: Percentage of People 25 and older living below $6.85/day, by gender

NAME: edexpslconv
DEFINITION: Education Secondary Lower expenditure per student as % of gdppc convergence time to function
Parameter Explanation: Lower Secondary per student  expenditure as % of gdppc convergence time to function in years.  In the base case a shift from the function will be maintained because of the high convergence time.Scenarios with low convergence time make the per student cost rich those of high income countries as countries get richer. This increase in per student cost can come from lower pupil-teacher ratio, higher teacher salary and higher non-teacher salary portion of the cost.

NAME: edexpsuconv
DEFINITION: Education Secondary Upper expenditure per student as % of gdppc convergence time to function
Parameter Explanation: Upper Secondary per student  expenditure as % of gdppc convergence time to function in years.  In the base case a shift from the function will be maintained because of the high convergence time.Scenarios with low convergence time make the per student cost rich those of high income countries as countries get richer. This increase in per student cost can come from lower pupil-teacher ratio, higher teacher salary and higher non-teacher salary portion of the cost.

NAME: WEP

NAME: WFORST

NAME: WGDP
DEFINITION: World GDP

NAME: govrevtrgtyr

NAME: govrevtrgtval
DEFINITION: Government Revenue, Target Value as Percentage of GDP
Parameter Explanation: This parameter specifies the target value for government revenue collection, expressed as a percentage of GDP. It is used in combination with govrevtrgtyr that defines the number of years to reach the target value from the initial year.

NAME: edseclowrgndreqgrad
DEFINITION: Education lower sec, gender parity time goal for graduation
Parameter Explanation: Education lower sec, no of years by which gender parity index for graduation rate reaches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate. Must set edgndreqsuron=1 for this to work.

NAME: ifsexomodeltype
DEFINITION: How Use Exogenous Series? (1 absolute values, 2 annual % changes)

NAME: LIQUIDITY

NAME: edsecupprgndreqgrad
DEFINITION: Education upper sec, gender parity, time goal for graduation
Parameter Explanation: Education upper sec, no of years by which gender parity index for graduation rate reaches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate. Must set edgndreqsuron=1 for this to work.

NAME: edseclowrgram
DEFINITION: Education, Lower Secondary, Graduation rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Education Lower Secondary Graduation Rate Multiplier.

NAME: edseclowrgradgr
DEFINITION: Education, lower secondary, general, Graduation rate, annual growth parameter
Parameter Explanation: Education, lower secondary (general), Graduation rate to the last grade, annual additive growth. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual additive growth in the survival rate in general lower secondary.

NAME: edsecupprgram
DEFINITION: Education, Upper Secondary, Graduation rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Education Upper Secondary Graduation Rate Multiplier.

NAME: resorunconm
DEFINITION: Resources of unconventional energy (fossil fuels), multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Ultimately recoverable unconventional resource multiplier, by energy type.  This parameter allows the user to increase or decrease ultimately recoverable resource values.  A value of 1 accepts the values of RESOR as specified.  A value of 1.5 would raise the resource levels for a specific energy form in a specific country/region by 50 percent.  This multiplier is unusual in that it is only important in the first year - it should not be changed over time because after ultimate resources are calculated the first year they can only run down (be used up).

NAME: resoruncon
DEFINITION: Resources of unconventional fossil fuels, ultimate,
Parameter Explanation: Resources of unconventional fossil fuels, ultimate, billion barrels of oil equivalent.  This value only sets an initial condition; thereafter resources are computed taking into account depletion from production.

NAME: etechadvuncon
DEFINITION: Unconventional energy production technology, annual decease in cost
Parameter Explanation: Unconventional energy technology advance rate (decrease in cost of energy production), expressed in decimal form (e.g. 0.01 equals 1 percent annual growth, by energy type).  Use, for example, to decrease the cost of renewable energy over time.  A value of 0.01 applied to renewable energy would force an annual decrease in the costs of producing solar energy of 1% each year, representing continued technological advance in such production (a value of -0.01 would represent a negative cost decrease, that is, a cost increase).

NAME: CPCTND
DEFINITION: Consumption percent needed among workers to match retirement age and Life Expectancy

NAME: cpctnduse
DEFINITION: Percent used of needed consumption
Parameter Explanation: Proportion of required consumption that is allocated to address the impact of aging.

NAME: GOVHHPENTND

DEFINITION: Government to household transfers needed for pensions, total
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that specifies the target percentage of the required government transfers (pensions) to households, under assumptions of aging burdens.

DEFINITION: Deaths by mortality type

NAME: HLOBESITY
DEFINITION: Obesity Rate

NAME: hlobesitym
DEFINITION: Obesity Rate Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on obesity rate.

NAME: HLSMOKING

NAME: hlsmokingm
DEFINITION: Smoking Rate Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the rate of smoking among adults over the age of 30.

NAME: LIFEXPHLM

NAME: HLBMI

NAME: HLDIABETESRR
DEFINITION: Diabetes Relative Risk

NAME: hllongvtystartage
DEFINITION: Start Age to apply Longevity Logistic Curve

NAME: ICTINTNETHH
DEFINITION: Percentage of households with Internet access

NAME: ictintnethhm
DEFINITION: ICT, Internet, Percentage of households with Internet access, Muliplier
Parameter Explanation: Percentage of households with Internet access, multiplier to change the percentage exogenously

NAME: ictcomputersm

NAME: AGP

NAME: AGX
DEFINITION: Agricultural exports

NAME: AID
DEFINITION: Aid (foreign), net

NAME: aidlpm
DEFINITION: Aid (foreign) loan portion multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Aid, loan portio multiplier.  This multiplier interacts with the coefficient that determines the portion of foreign aid that actually constitutes loans.

NAME: INFRAINDELECCOMPMEANI
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, electricity, component initial mean

NAME: npowf

Parameter Explanation: Nuclear power factor, warheads/billion $ expenditure.

NAME: infrateledtfp

Parameter Explanation: Parameter for fixed telephone network divestment  time, number of years from peak. Peak is at 30% of mobile phone access.

NAME: hlsmokingceiling
DEFINITION: Smoking Rate Ceiling
Parameter Explanation: User can specify maximum smoking prevalence, Impacts countries rising through stage 2 (risking to peak).

NAME: infraroadraisetar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, rural road access, target standard error, number
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of Standard Errors to be targeted by the forecast (between -2 and 2), 0 turns off the targetting.

NAME: infraroadraiseyrtar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, rural road access, target standard error, years to attain
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: ally
DEFINITION: Alliance membership (0=none; 1=alliance)
Parameter Explanation: Alliance membership switch.  A value of 1 indicates membership in the acting alliance and a value of 2 indicates membership in the reacting alliance (either alliance can consist of a single country or region).  Alliances can form or dissolve over time; membership in alliances can change.  None of that will, however, happen endogenously; you must specify alliance structures.  Alliance membership only affects war damage, not threat levels or war outbreak.

NAME: VEHICFLPC
DEFINITION: Vehicle fleet per capita

NAME: DEATHTRPV
DEFINITION: Deaths from traffic per vehicle

NAME: edsecupprgradgr
DEFINITION: Education, upper secondary, general, Graduation rate, annual growth
Parameter Explanation: Education, upper secondary (general), Graduation rate to the last grade, annual additive growth. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual additive growth in the survival rate in general upper secondary.

NAME: mhw
DEFINITION: iMport propensity, historical (inertial) delay in change
Parameter Explanation: Import propensity, historical (inertial) delay in change.  Values near 1.0 imply very rapid adjustment and values near 0 imply little or no adjustment.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: survseadd
DEFINITION: Survival/self-expression index addition
Parameter Explanation: Additive factor to introduce a shift in Survival/self-expression index for a region/country.  It increases or decreases the index value that the model calculates.  The normal value is zero.  See also and contrast with cultshmp, which is a cultural shift for the large cultural regions identified in the WVS project and which is calculated from data.

NAME: tradsratadd
DEFINITION: Traditional/secular-rational index addition
Parameter Explanation: Additive factor to introduce a shift in Traditional/rational-secular indexindex for a region/country.  It increases or decreases the index value that the model calculates.  The normal value is zero.  See also and contrast with cultshmp, which is a cultural shift for the large cultural regions identified in the WVS project and which is calculated from data.

NAME: igdpr
DEFINITION: Initial GDP growth rate, decimal form
Parameter Explanation: Initial GDP growth rate, expressed in decimal form.  A value of 0.03 is equal to a rate of 3%.  Only changes in this parameter for the very first year of the model run will affect model behavior.

NAME: IMARK
DEFINITION: Initial markup of prices over cost

NAME: LABS
DEFINITION: Labor by sector

NAME: LAPOPR
DEFINITION: Labor participation rate
Parameter Explanation: No longer used as parameter.  Now a computed variable.

NAME: LD
DEFINITION: Land
Parameter Explanation: Land in million hectares, by region and land category.  You can change this initial condition to represent different assumptions about land availability for agriculture.  Only initial values can be changed; the model subsequently computes land by category endogenously.

NAME: FEMSHRLAB
DEFINITION: Female share of the labor force

NAME: GOVBUSCOST
DEFINITION: Cost of starting a busness, percent of per capita income

NAME: govbuscostm
DEFINITION: Cost of starting a business multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the cost of starting a business.

NAME: GOVBUSREGIND
DEFINITION: Government regulation of business index (higher is more)

DEFINITION: Government regulation of business index multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the level of government regulation of Business Index.

NAME: labinformcoeffed
DEFINITION: Informal labor share,coefficient of education years
Parameter Explanation: This parameter is used to change the coefficient of education years (15+ years, both sexes)  in the multiple regression of informal labor shares.

NAME: POVGAP365

NAME: POVGAP685
DEFINITION: Poverty Gap based on $6.85/day income ($2017)

Parameter Explanation: Share of GDS(MIL) cap on MARMS

DEFINITION: Multiplier on Share of Female in Marriage or Union
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for the share of female who are in a marriage or a union. Values greater than 1 raises the share relative to the base case value for the same year. Values lower than 1 lowers the share.

DEFINITION: Impact of Marriage of Girls On School School Graduation, Lower Secondary, Girls
Parameter Explanation: Responsiveness of lower secondary graduation rate of girls to changes in the share of girls married. A value of .5 means a increase in the graduation rate by half a percentage point for a 1 percent reduction in the share of girls who are in a marriage.

NAME: marriageedsecuppr
DEFINITION: Impact of Marriage of Girls On School School Graduation, Upper Secondary, Girls
Parameter Explanation: Responsiveness of upper secondary graduation rate of girls to changes in the share of girls married. A value of .5 means a increase in the graduation rate by half a percentage point for a 1 percent reeducation in the share of girls who are in a marriage.

NAME: ageofmarriagem
DEFINITION: Age of Marriage Value, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: The rate of change for age of marriage impacted by a multliplier.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: xwblnfinm
DEFINITION: World Bank loans (flows in), multiplier

NAME: XIMFSUBF
DEFINITION: Subscriptions to the IMF, annual new flows, billion currency

NAME: labfemshrm

NAME: ldwf

Parameter Explanation: Incremental land used for residential, transportation and industrial purposes, in hectares per capita of population.  It quantifies the transition of land associated with net population changes between urban and other land types like crop, grazing, or forest areas.

NAME: LIFEXP
DEFINITION: Life expectancy

Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the democracy wave length in years (peak to trough/half-wave).  Historical waves of democracy have been variable in length, so it is very reasonable to speculate that they could change from the base value or over time.

NAME: DEMOCWVCOUNT
DEFINITION: Democracy wave counter: years current wave direction has been running

NAME: elgrevdebt2

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of government revenues to changes in government debt levels.  Elprst1 and elprst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: labretagem
DEFINITION: Labor force, multliplier on retirement age
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on labor force retirement age. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year

NAME: gdstrgtval

NAME: gdsbudgetconv

NAME: watprid

Parameter Explanation: Responsiveness of water price to change in stock/inventory levels.

NAME: LABPARR

NAME: HDIMF

Parameter Explanation: Responsiveness of water price to stock/inventory levels.  watprii and watprid are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities), most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: WATPRICE

NAME: wastewatertreatedm

NAME: waterrenewconverge

Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the time for country to return to exploitable limit of renewable freshwater resources.

NAME: watertoyieldswitch

Parameter Explanation: Switch to allow water to constrain agricultural yields.

NAME: AITASK

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Artificial Inteligence Index for Specific Tasks.

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Artificial Inteligence Machine IQ.

NAME: agxm
DEFINITION: Agricultural exports multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on agricultural exports, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase investment and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: enmm
DEFINITION: Energy imports multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on energy imports, by region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase imports and lower values decrease them.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: enxm
DEFINITION: Energy exports multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on energy exports, by region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase exports and lower values decrease them.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: msm
DEFINITION: Multiplier on imports by sector
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on import, by sector and region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase imports and lower values decrease them.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: xsm
DEFINITION: Multiplier on exports by sector
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on exports by sector and region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase exports and lower values decrease them.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

DEFINITION: State failure probability from Economic pressure

NAME: SFGOV

NAME: SFIMBAL
DEFINITION: State failure probability from Structural Imbalances pressure

NAME: labparm

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on labor participation rate. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value.

NAME: LABUNEMPR

NAME: CLPCMDER

NAME: CLPCCV

NAME: diploembassym

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Standarized Number of Embassies that a country can have in other countries in a given year

NAME: POPEDSECUPPRGRAD

NAME: POPEDTERGRAD

NAME: EDSECLOWRENRGGRD

NAME: igdprcor

NAME: ken

NAME: ENPCAPUT

NAME: agxvaluem

Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: xportwgrm

NAME: trucksconv
DEFINITION: Truck sales, convergence to expected value
Parameter Explanation: Convergence time for truck sales in years. This value determines the number of years over which all countries/regions will converge to the chosen function (as determined by the switch, vehfuncsw) for the computation of truck sales per year.  A value of 1000 would effectively turn off convergence, so that initial country-specific variations from the function would be maintained over time.  A value of 60 would lead to near convergence by the middle of the 21st century.  Very rapid convergence seems improbable in the face of fundamental country differences in infrastructure, land area, culture, etc.

NAME: wpcon
DEFINITION: World politics, change in dispute threat with power concentration
Parameter Explanation: World politics, change in dispute threat with power concentration.  This value is used in a function as a multiplier on global power concentration among great powers (PCONGREAT), a variable which itself normally ranges from approximately 0.2 to 0.4.  The change in the result of the product from year to year provides an additive term that can be interpreted as an additive increase (or decrease) in the probability of disputes between two countries/regions.

NAME: wpconsq
DEFINITION: World politics, change in dispute threat with change in power concentration
Parameter Explanation: World politics, change in dispute threat with the square of change in power concentration (see also wpcon).  This value is used in a function as a multiplier on the square of global power concentration among great powers (PCONGREAT), a variable which itself normally ranges from approximately 0.2 to 0.4.  The change in the result of the product of the parameter and the square of concentration from year to year provides an additive term that can be interpreted as an additive increase (or decrease) in the probability of disputes between two countries/regions.

NAME: wpthrwar
DEFINITION: World politics, portion of all disputes that escalate to wars
Parameter Explanation: World politics, portion of all disputes that escalate to wars.  The value is in percent. Thus 3.3 would indicate that the probability of a war between two states would be 3.3% if they experienced a militarized international dispute (or 0.33% if the probability of a dispute were 10%).  This parameter is not now being use to generate wars from disputes.

Significant changes in the value from specification in the base case could lead to difficulties or instability in energy market clearing (balancing of supply and demand).

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy discoveries to prices.  This value should be positive and normally will not change much over time.  Significant changes in the value from specification in the base case could lead to difficulties or instability in energy markets.

NAME: agconv
DEFINITION: Agricultural demand convergence time to function
Parameter Explanation: Agriculture demand convergence time, represents the time required  for agricultural demand to converge to the function's predicted values, in years. Initial country data may deviate from cross-sectional predictions due to possible data errors or unique country factors. This parameter assumes that over time, such discrepancies will align with the predicted values. A high value like 10000 stops convergence; a low value like 10 speeds it up.

NAME: AGDEM
DEFINITION: Agricultural demand

NAME: clpcm
DEFINITION: Per capita calorie demand multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on per capita calorie demand, by region and without units. A value of 1 indicates no change; higher values increase demand, and lower values decrease it. Avoid changing the initial year's value; instead, adjust the multiplier over time.

NAME: aginvm
DEFINITION: Agricultural investment multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on agriculture investment, by region and without units. A value of 1 indicates no change. Values greater than 1 increase investment proportionally, and values less than 1 decrease it. Avoid changing the initial year value; instead, adjust the multiplier over time.

NAME: AGM
DEFINITION: Agricultural imports

NAME: agon
DEFINITION: Agriculture-economy linkage parameter (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: Agriculture switch turns on or off the linkages  between the agricultural submodel and all others, including economy. A value of 1 turns the linkages on; 0 turns them off. Useful for isolating submodels during analysis. Typically set to 1.

NAME: hivculf
DEFINITION: HIV, cultural region-specific spread rate
Parameter Explanation: Cultural region-specific spread rate of HIV, expressed in percentage terms. For example, a value of 0.3 means 0.3% growth in spread rate each year.  This parameter is set for broad cultural regions such as the Islamic world and the  values have generally been set so that historic growth patterns coincide with actual tendencies in the region.

NAME: CO2PER
DEFINITION: CO2, percentage increase in atmosphere, pre-industrial base

NAME: co2prein
DEFINITION: CO2, parts per million in atmosphere, pre-industrial base
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that defines the pre-industrial level of atmospheric CO2 in parts per million. Normally, a user would not change this parameter over time. See also carprein - that sets the pre-industrial atmospheric carbon levels in billion tons.

NAME: CO2PPM
DEFINITION: CO2, parts per million in atmosphere

NAME: CONTRUSE
DEFINITION: Contraception use, percent of fertile women

NAME: hlmortmodsw
DEFINITION: Mortality Modification Switch (2=2002 WHO version, 1=2004 WHO version-default, 0=Ifs version)
Parameter Explanation: Switch for mortality modification. A value of 2 turns on the Modification for the Human Capital (Education) term and for the Technology (Time) term, in both cases using the WHO low-income-model clasification (WHO 2002 version).  A value of 1 turns on the Modification for the Technology (Time) term using the IFs low-income clasification ($3k/cap), default is 1-On in the base case (2004 WHO version). A value of 0 turns it off and leaves mortality unchanged .

NAME: edtergradgr
DEFINITION: Education, tertiary, graduation rate, annual growth
Parameter Explanation: Education, tertiary, graduation rate, annual additive growth. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual additive growth in the rate of graduation in tertiary level.

NAME: elndpow
DEFINITION: Elasticity of nuclear damage with nuclear power
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of nuclear damage with nuclear power.  Values (normally positive) near 0 would imply little elasticity and values near 1 would imply very considerable elasticity.  Changes in this parameter will only have an effect when the model generates a nuclear war.

NAME: elprst1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of prices to stock/inventory levels
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of prices to stock/inventory levels.  Elprst1 and elprst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: waterhhm
DEFINITION: Water service, percent of people with access, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for the percentage of people living with different levels of access to drinking water. Values greater than 1 raises access relative to the base case value for the same year. Values lower than 1 reduce access.

NAME: SANITHHCOSTLOWER
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation services, capital cost per person as a percentage of GDP per capita, lower-cost service

NAME: sanithhcostlowershr
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation services, share of services using lower-cost service
Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, Sanitation services, share of services using lower-cost service. Base case value is 50/50 when both lower and upper cost services are available

NAME: SANITHHDEMPOP
DEFINITION: Sanitation service, number of people with access, desired

NAME: SANITHHDEM
DEFINITION: Sanitation, percent of population with access,  desired value

NAME: watsafenewsw
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water and Sanitation 5 Category Switch, 1 will use 5 category for infrastructure spending and forward linkage
Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, water and Sanitation 5 Category Switch, 1 will use 5 category for infrastructure spending and forward linkage

NAME: waterhhlifepiped

Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, safe water connections, piped, lifetime in years

Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, sanitation, basic pit latrine, lifetime in years

NAME: sanithhlifepitlatrinetrad

Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, sanitation, rural traditional pit latrine, lifetime in years

NAME: sanithhbasictrgtval
DEFINITION: Sanitation services, at least basic, target value to be reached by a certain number (sanithhbasictrgtyr) of years starting from the model base year
Parameter Explanation: Sanitation services, at least basic, target value to be reached by a certain number (sanithhbasictrgtyr) of years starting from the model base year. Default value is 100.

NAME: SANITHHINVESTCAP
DEFINITION: Sanitation Services, Investment Needed, Capital Expenditure

NAME: SANITHHINVESTMAINT
DEFINITION: Sanitation Services, Investment Needed, Maintenance Expenditure

NAME: sanithhm
DEFINITION: Sanitation service, percent of people with access, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for the percentage of people living with different levels of access to drinking water. Values greater than 1 raises access relative to the base case value for the same year. Values lower than 1 reduce access.

NAME: WATERHH
DEFINITION: Water service, percent of population with access

NAME: ageofmarriagetfrelas
DEFINITION: Elasticity of age of marriage to total fertility rate
Parameter Explanation: Responsiveness of TFR to changes in average age of marriage from expected value, i.e., base case forecast. A value of .01 will decrease TFR by .01 when age of marriage is one year more than the base case forecast.

NAME: WOMENINLEADERSHIP
DEFINITION: Percent of Managerial Roles Filled by Women

NAME: FOODINSECURITY
DEFINITION: Percent of Population Experiencing Moderate Food Insecurity by Gender

NAME: foodinsecuritym
DEFINITION: Food Insecurity Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Food Security Index. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: womeninleadershipm
DEFINITION: Managerial Rolles Filled by Women Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on managerial roles filled by women. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: unpaidlaborm
DEFINITION: Unpaid Labor Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on unpaid labor force. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: POP15ANDABOVE
DEFINITION: Population, ages 15 and above

NAME: POP25ANDABOVE
DEFINITION: Population, ages 25 and above

NAME: WATERHHDEM
DEFINITION: Water service, percent of population with access, desired value

NAME: INFRAELECACCPOP
DEFINITION: Electricity, number of people with access to electricity

NAME: WATERHHPOP
DEFINITION: Water service, number of people with access

NAME: SANITHHPOP
DEFINITION: Sanitation, number of people with access

NAME: WATERHHDEMPOP
DEFINITION: Water service, number of people with access, desired

NAME: watsafefwdsw
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water and sanitation, switch, 1 (base value) will turn all forward linkages on, 0 turns them off
Parameter Explanation: Infrastructure, water and Sanitation 5 Category Switch, 1 will use 5 category for forward linkage, 0 will use 3 category for forward linkage. This does not affect spending.

NAME: waterbudgetprotec
DEFINITION: Infrastructure Spending, Budget Demand for Water Services, Protected Share
Parameter Explanation: This parameter is for budget protection of water services spending. (1 = full protection, 0 is no protection) Values in between 0 and 1 indicates the share of demanded budget that will be set aside of the normalization process.

NAME: sanitbudgetprotec
DEFINITION: Infrastructure Spending, Budget Demand for Sanitation Services, Protected Share
Parameter Explanation: This parameter is for budget protection of sanitation services spending. Values greater than 1 raises the cost relative to the base case value for the same year. Values lower than 1 lowers the cost.

NAME: infrabudgetprotec
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, public spending, protected share of demand by infrastructure type
Parameter Explanation: This parameter is for budget protection by infrastructure type. (1 = full protection, 0 is no protection) Values in between 0 and 1 indicates the share of demanded budget that will be set aside from the budget allocated for infrastructure in the government finance model.

NAME: elprst2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of prices to changes in stock/inventory levels
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of prices to change in stock/inventory levels.  Elprst1 and elprst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: govcorruptm
DEFINITION: Government corruption, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government corruption index.

NAME: ECONINTEG
DEFINITION: Economic integration index (base year values from 0 to 100 as highest)

NAME: PERSCON
DEFINITION: Personal contact index

NAME: MFPHC
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity contribution from human capital

NAME: tefinfadjm
DEFINITION: Productivity adjustment from informal economy multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the adjustment of productivity (TEF) because of the extent of informal economy. A value of 0 indicates no adjustment and a value of 1 indicates full adjustment.

NAME: gdpinformshrm
DEFINITION: Informal GDP share multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the informal share of GDP.

NAME: hlincoefgr
DEFINITION: Income coefficient growth
Parameter Explanation: GBD Regression's Income coefficient growth.

NAME: hlgbdconvDown
DEFINITION: Downward Convergence Time Coefficient
Parameter Explanation: Convergence time coefficient for bringing initial adjustments/normalization factors towards 1, downward convergence only

NAME: envylchgadd
DEFINITION: Agricultural Annual Yield Change additive shift factor
Parameter Explanation: Global additive shift factor for the annual change in agricultural yield by country/region.

NAME: hltechshift
DEFINITION: Technological shift factor for altering technological change, proportional to GDP per capita
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the technological shift factor to alter technological change, proportional to GDP per capita.

NAME: envco2fert
DEFINITION: Crop CO2 Sensitivity
Parameter Explanation: Effect of CO2 fertilization on crop yields.

NAME: sanithldsw
DEFINITION: Sanitation hold switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch to hold the forecast of Sanitation at Base year levels

NAME: watsafhldsw
DEFINITION: Safe Water hold switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch to hold the forecast of Safe Water at Base year levels

NAME: ensolflhldsw
DEFINITION: Solid Fuel use hold switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch to hold the forecast of Solid Fuel Use at Base year levels

NAME: envpm25hldsw
DEFINITION: Residential PM2.5 levels hold switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch to hold the forecast of residential PM2.5 air pollution levels. A value of 0 indicates off; 1 indicates on.

NAME: malnhldsw
DEFINITION: Malnutrition hold switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch to hold the forecast of malnutrition among children.

NAME: sfmassrep
DEFINITION: State failure switch/multiplier (>0.05=On), internal war repression by govt
Parameter Explanation: Switch for state failure mass repression. A value of 1 turns on totalitarian system-like repression that suppresses domestic conflict of any kind and value of 0 represents no such change (default case).

NAME: infrainvmaintpubshrm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, portion of maintenance fund coming from public sector
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the public share in funding maintenance of infrastructure of a specific type.

NAME: infrainvnewpubshrm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, portion of new construction fund coming from public sector
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the public share in funding maintenance of infrastructure of a specific type.

NAME: INFRAROADDEM
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, road network density (roads per land area), demand

NAME: INFRAROADPAVEDPCNTDEM
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, road network, percentage paved, demand

NAME: INFRATELEDEM
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, telephone network density, Line per 100, desired

NAME: CRETIRE
DEFINITION: Private consumption of population in retirement years

NAME: INFRAROADPAVEDCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, road, cost of adding a lane-km of paved road

NAME: hlmortm
DEFINITION: Mortality Multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on mortality.

NAME: hlmorbtomortgthport
DEFINITION: Morbidity to Mortality growth portion
Parameter Explanation: This parameter controls the rate of growth of morbidity relative to mortality. For example, Cardio Vascular Disease has a value of 0.5, indicating that for each unit of decrease in CVD mortality there's only a decrease of 0.5 in CVD morbidity

NAME: LABDEMS
DEFINITION: Labor demand by sector

NAME: labmarketsw
DEFINITION: Labor demand to economic production switch (1=on)
Parameter Explanation: Switch to turn on the impact of changes in labor demand to computation of value added (normally supply affects it and changes more slowly)

NAME: elwageunemp1
DEFINITION: PID elasticity 1 of labor wage index response to unemployment
Parameter Explanation: First parameter in PID controller that links unemployment level  to change in labor wage index.

NAME: elwageunemp2
DEFINITION: PID elasticity 2 of labor wage index response to delta unemploymen
Parameter Explanation: Second parameter in PID controller that links change in unemployment level  to change in labor wage index.

NAME: ellabwage1
DEFINITION: PID elasticity 1 of labor response to wage index
Parameter Explanation: First parameter in PID controller that links labor wage index  to change in labor demand

NAME: elfdilifexp
DEFINITION: Elasticity of fdi to extra years of life expectancy
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of foreign direct investment to gains in years of life expectancy.

NAME: protecm
DEFINITION: Protectionism in trade, multipler on import prices
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on trade protection, by region allows user to adjust the price of imported goods, relative to the base case. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the prices of imported goods and lower values decrease them.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: ENSOLFUEL
DEFINITION: Population% that relies on solid fuels as the primary source of domestic energy for cooking and heating

NAME: ensolfuelm
DEFINITION: Solid Fuel use multiplier

NAME: HPI1
DEFINITION: Human poverty index 1, UN Development Program's measure

NAME: ensolfuelsetar

Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of Standard Errors to be targeted by the forecast (between -2 and 2), 0 turns off the targetting.

NAME: ensolfuelseyrtar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Solid Fuel Use, years to target standard error
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: extmafuncelectran
DEFINITION: Extrapolative formulation, moving average factor, function, electricity transmission
Parameter Explanation: This parameter decides the moving average factor for the growthrate required to move along the function.

NAME: extmafuncroad
DEFINITION: Extrapolative formulation, moving average factor, function, road
Parameter Explanation: This parameter decides the moving average factor for the growthrate required to move along the function.

NAME: extmafuncroadpaved
DEFINITION: Extrapolative formulation, moving average factor, function, road paved
Parameter Explanation: This parameter decides the moving average factor for the growthrate required to move along the function.

NAME: extmaposnconvtimeelectran
DEFINITION: Extrapolative formulation, moving average, position, convergence time, electricity transmission
Parameter Explanation: This parameter represents the time required to converge to the function from the current position.

NAME: extmaposnconvtimeroad
DEFINITION: Extrapolative formulation, moving average, position, convergence time, road
Parameter Explanation: This parameter represents the time required to converge to the function from the current position.

NAME: MATPOSTR
DEFINITION: Materialism/postmaterialism index

NAME: mprconv
DEFINITION: Materialism/postmaterialism, convergence time  to expected
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the convergence time of Materialism/postmaterialism to expected valye based on the analytic function. Very often initial data values for countries will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

NAME: CARS
DEFINITION: Car sales, annual

NAME: GEM
DEFINITION: Gender empowerment measure of UN Development Program

NAME: resorm
DEFINITION: Resources of energy (fossil fuels), multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Ultimately recoverable resource multiplier, by energy type.  This parameter allows the user to increase or decrease ultimately recoverable resource values.  A value of 1 accepts the values of RESOR as specified.  A value of 1.5 would raise the resource levels for a specific energy form in a specific country/region by 50 percent.  This multiplier is unusual in that it is only important in the first year - it should not be changed over time because after ultimate resources are calculated the first year they can only run down (be used up).

NAME: RETRAT
DEFINITION: Return ratio on land/yield investments

NAME: SDEATH
DEFINITION: Starvation deaths

NAME: slr
DEFINITION: Slaughter rate, livestock
Parameter Explanation: Livestock slaughter rate coefficient represents the proportion of herd slaughtered annually. For example, a rate of 0.7 means 70% of the herd is slaughtered each year.

NAME: MODYEAR
DEFINITION: Model, year to which it has been run

NAME: wagnerc
DEFINITION: Wagner's law coeficient; annual growth in govt expenditures
Parameter Explanation: Wagner's law coeficient; annual growth in govt expenditures.  Wagner's Law (from the late 1800s) said that government expenditures would continue to increase as a portion of GDP.  Although this effect must ultimately saturate (the model limits it), it has continued into the 21st century.  You can set a value in terms of annual percentage increase (or decrease) in government/GDP. Thus, 1 = 1% annual increase in the ratio.

NAME: HHGOVSS
DEFINITION: Household social security payments to government, by skill level

NAME: infraelecgencostm

NAME: carstotm
DEFINITION: Car sales, total multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on total car sales by country/region.  A value of 1.0 leaves total sales unchanged.  An increase over time to 2.0 would approximately double total sales relative to the base case (sales by type will not always change proportionately, because of differing relationships with total sales).

NAME: truckstotm
DEFINITION: Truck sales, total, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on total truck sales by country/region.  A value of 1.0 leaves total sales unchanged.  An increase over time to 2.0 would approximately double total sales relative to the base case (sales by type will not always change proportionately, because of differing relationships with total sales).

NAME: SURVSE
DEFINITION: Survival/self-expression index

NAME: ENDEMSH
DEFINITION: Energy demand, most recent data or estimation

NAME: ictbroadmobiltrgtyr
DEFINITION: Universal Mobile Broadband Access Target Year (number of years from starting point)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal access to mobile broadband

NAME: ictbroadtrgtyr
DEFINITION: Universal Fixed Broadband Access Target Year (number of years from starting point)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal access to fixed broadband

NAME: infraroadraitrgtyr
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, rural road access,  no of years taken (from base year) to reach universal access
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal access to roads.

NAME: INFRAINDELEC
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, electricity sub-index

NAME: carsconv
DEFINITION: Car sales, convergence time to functions
Parameter Explanation: Convergence time for car sales in years. This value determines the number of years over which all countries/regions will converge to the chosen function (as determined by the switch, vehfuncsw) for the computation of car sales per year.  A value of 10000 would effectively turn off convergence, so that initial country-specific variations from the function would be maintained over time.  A value of 60 would lead to near convergence by the middle of the 21st century.  Very rapid convergence seems improbable in the face of fundamental country differences in infrastructure, land area, culture, etc.

NAME: INFRAINDELECCOMPSDI
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, electricity, component initial standard deviation

NAME: infraindeleccompwt

NAME: edpriintngr

Parameter Explanation: Education Primary Net Intake Rate Anuual Growth Rate. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual percentage growth in net intake rate.

NAME: edprisurgr
DEFINITION: Education, primary, survival rate, annual growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Education Primary Survival Rate Annual Growth Rate. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual percentage growth in survival rate.

NAME: edseclowrtrangr
DEFINITION: Education, lower secondary, general, transion rate, annual growth parameter
Parameter Explanation: Education, lower secondary (general), transion rate from primary, annual additive growth. A parameter to make the countries meet education targets by an annual additive growth in the rate of transition from primary to general lower secondary.

NAME: edtergndreqint
DEFINITION: Education tertiary, gender parity time for intake
Parameter Explanation: Education tertiary, no of years by which gender parity index for intake rate raeches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate.

NAME: edtergndreqgrad
DEFINITION: Education tertiary, gender parity time goal for graduation
Parameter Explanation: Education tertiary, no of years by which gender parity index for graduation rate reaches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate. Must set edgndreqsuron=1 for this to work.

NAME: edsecupprgndreqtran
DEFINITION: Education upper sec, gender parity time for transition
Parameter Explanation: Education upper sec, no of years by which gender parity index for transition rate raeches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate.

NAME: ldcropm

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on crop land, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase crop land and lower values decrease it.

NAME: TEFF

NAME: agstkadjsw

NAME: agtrdadjsw

NAME: agmm

Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: HLSTUNTCHL

NAME: CHILDDTHR

NAME: CHLMOR

NAME: watpricetoylelas

NAME: WATDEMPERHA
DEFINITION: Water demand per hectare of irrigated land

NAME: wpindsw
DEFINITION: Character of Bilateral State Interaction Score switch
Parameter Explanation: A switch that can be used to turn on or off the calculations of Character of Bilateral State Interaction Score.  A value of 0 turns it off and a value greater than 0 turns it on.  1 is used to save threat, 2 is used to save Liberal Index, 3 is used to save Realist Index and 4 is used to save the COI.

NAME: ictmobilsetar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, ICT Mobile Phones, strandard error target
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of Standard Errors to be targeted by the forecast (between -2 and 2), 0 turns off the targetting.

NAME: ictmobilseyrtar

Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: INFRACOSTADJFAC

NAME: eprodr
DEFINITION: Energy production growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Energy production growth rate, expressed in decimal form (e.g., 0.035 equals 3.5 percent annual growth, by region and fuel type. This parameter can override endogenous patterns of energy production growth and force a pattern of growth for a specific fuel or set of fuels.  Growth rates are, however, constrained in the model by the availability of investment and/or resources, and may not be met.  Only positive values are allowed.  Under most circumstances, the initial value for this variable should be equal to that of enprr for the specified region and fuel type, because enprr is the empirical initial growth rate.

NAME: EPROFITR
DEFINITION: Energy profit ratio index

NAME: eprohw
DEFINITION: Energy historical weight for profits in investment
Parameter Explanation: Energy profits, historic (inertial delay) in impact on investment.  Values near 1.0 imply very rapid adjustment and values near 0 imply little or no adjustment.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: etechadv
DEFINITION: Energy production technology, annual decease in cost
Parameter Explanation: Energy technology advance rate (decrease in cost of energy production), expressed in decimal form (e.g. 0.01 equals 1 percent annual growth, by energy type).  Use, for example, to decrease the cost of renewable energy over time.  A value of 0.01 applied to renewable energy would force an annual decrease in the costs of producing solar energy of 1% each year, representing continued technological advance in such production (a value of -0.01 would represent a negative cost decrease, that is, a cost increase).

NAME: eleniprof2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of energy investment to change in profit level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy investment to change in profit level.  Eleniprof and eleniprof2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: migrater
DEFINITION: Migration rate (inward), net percent of population
Parameter Explanation: Net migration of a population in percent per year (negative values reflect emigration and positive values reflect immigration).  Because global emigration and immigration must balance, changes in this value for a single country/region may not change migration/population as substantially as the change introduced in migrater.

NAME: enrgdpgr
DEFINITION: Energy demand to GDP ratio, annual technology-based change
Parameter Explanation: Annual percentage change in energy demand as a result of technological change.  This parameter helps represent the historic phenomenon of considerable decrease over time in energy requirements per unit of economic output ("dematerialization").  It is an uncertain but very important parameter.  A value of -1 would represent an annual efficiency improvement of 1 percent.

NAME: elastrpr
DEFINITION: Elasticity of trade with prices
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of trade with prices, by economic sector. A value of 1 implies a 1% increase in exports when local prices are 1% below world prices, and a similar increase in imports when local prices are 1% above world prices. Values generally range from 0 to 2 and remain constant over time. This parameter interacts with parameters elmpr1, elmpr2, elxpr1, and elxpr2, all of which play a role in the equilibrium-seeking structure of the economic/trade model.  Unfortunately, the collective meaning of these trade parameters in conventional elasticity terms is not as clear as it should be, because they have been set to assure market-clearing behavior.
