Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: watsafenoconsetar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, safe water, no connection, strandard error target
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of Standard Errors to be targeted by the forecast (between -2 and 2), 0 turns off the targetting.

NAME: watsafenoconseyrtar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, safe water, no connection, years to target standard error
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: watwastetreatsetar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, WasteWater, standard error target
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of Standard Errors to be targeted by the forecast (between -2 and 2), 0 turns off the targetting.

NAME: watwastetreatseyrtar
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, WasteWater, years to target standard error
Parameter Explanation: Sets the number of years to target a given number of Standard Errors by the forecast.

NAME: mfpdemoc
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to democracy
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Democracy contribution to MFP.

NAME: infraelecaccurbancostm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access, urban, multiplier on cost of adding a connection
Parameter Explanation: This parameter can be used to change the unit cost for a particular country or region relative to the base case.

NAME: infraelecaccurbancostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access, urban, cost of a new connection, global upper bound

NAME: infraelecaccurbanlife
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity transmission lines, urban, lifetime

NAME: INFRAINDICTZ
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, ICT index with Z-score formulation

NAME: INFRAINDICTZCOMPMEANI
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, ICTZ, component initial mean

NAME: INFRAINDICTZCOMPSDI
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, ICTZ, component initial standard deviation

NAME: infraindictzcompwt
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index,ICTZ, component weight (1=equal weighting, 0=not included)

NAME: landircostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Per Hectare Cost of Irrigation, global lower bound
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that sets a global lower bound value on per hectare cost of irrigation.

NAME: EDSECUPPRENRG
DEFINITION: Education, Upper Secondary, gross enrollment (% of age group)

NAME: EDSECUPPRTOT
DEFINITION: Education, Upper Secondary, total students

NAME: LANDIRAREAEQUIPDEM
DEFINITION: Irrigation, land area equipped for irrigation, demand

NAME: landircostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Per Hectare Cost of Irrigation, global upper bound
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that sets a global upper bound value on per hectare cost of irrigation.

NAME: SANITATIONIMPCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, cost of providing other improved sources, per person

NAME: sanitationimpcostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, OtherImproved cost, global lower bound

NAME: sanitationimpcostm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, multiplier on cost of adding other improve sources, per person
Parameter Explanation: Parameter to change the unit cost relative to the base case.

NAME: sanitationimpcostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, OtherImproved cost, global upper bound

NAME: sanitationimplife
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, other improved, lifetime

NAME: WATSAFEIMPCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water, cost of providing other improved sources, per person

NAME: watsafeimpcostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water connection, OtherImproved cost, global lower bound

NAME: watsafeimpcostm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water, multiplier on cost of adding other improve sources, per person
Parameter Explanation: Parameter to change the unit cost relative to the base case.

NAME: watsafeimpcostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water connection, OtherImproved cost, global upper bound

NAME: watsafetrgtval
DEFINITION: Safe Water Access Target, value for fixed target, percent w/o access to safe water, works with watsafetrgtyr
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the value of percentage with no access considered as universal access to safe water (for example, 0 percent)

NAME: watsafeimplife
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water, other improved, lifetime

NAME: watwastetreatcostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Unit Cost of Waste Water Treatment, global lower bound

NAME: watwastetreatcostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Unit Cost of Waste Water Treatment, global upper bound

NAME: INFRAINDTRADEXP
DEFINITION: Infrastructure index, traditional, expected value for MFPPC contribution

NAME: sanitationtrgtval
DEFINITION: Sanitation Access Target, value for fixed target, percent with hh connection, works with sanitationtrgtyr
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the  value of percentage with household connections considered as universal access to sanitation.

NAME: EDSECUPPRVOC
DEFINITION: Education, Upper Secondary, vocational as % of enrollment in all programs

NAME: malnm
DEFINITION: Malnutrition, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multplier on malnutrition among the population. A value of 1 represents no change, 1.25 represents a 25 percent increase and .75 represents a 25 percent decrease.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: EDBASENRG
DEFINITION: Education, basic education (upto lower secondary), enrollment rate, gross

NAME: edseclowrgndreqtran
DEFINITION: Education lower sec, gender parity time for transition
Parameter Explanation: Education lower sec, no of years by which gender parity index for transition rate raeches 1. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate.

NAME: edseclowrtrancap
DEFINITION: Education, Lower Secondary, cap transition, parameter
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for setting the upper limit on transition or survival in lower secondary (1= cap transition)

NAME: edprigoalexperon
DEFINITION: Education, primary, normative goal seek, per student expenditure (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: Education Per Primary Student expenditure (as a % of GDPPC) Goal Seek Switch. A parameter to turn goal seek on. Works with edprigoalexper

NAME: edprigoalexper
DEFINITION: Education, primary, per student expenditure goal
Parameter Explanation: Education Per Primary Student expenditure (as a % of GDPPC) Goal. A parameter to make the countries meet per student expenditure goals, e.g. bes practices. You must set edprigoalexperon to 1 for this to work.

NAME: elagind
DEFINITION: Elasticity of industrial (incl energy) use of crops with energy price
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of industrial (incl energy) use of crops with energy price.  0 turns it off.

NAME: ylmaxgr
DEFINITION: Yields (agricultural), maximum annual growth
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that roughly controls the the maximum increase in agricultural yields (.05 would be 5% annually).  It is phased downward at the hhighest values of current yields.

NAME: calmax
DEFINITION: Calories, maximum needed per day per person
Parameter Explanation: Maximum kilocalories needed per person per day. This biologically determined value should generally not change over time.

NAME: calmeatm
DEFINITION: Calories, portion obtained from meat multiplier (first year only)
Parameter Explanation: Maximum proportion of calories from meat, increasing with income up to this cap. The value, between 0 and 1, is typically set only in the first year.

NAME: CAPUT
DEFINITION: Capacity utilization, economic sectors

NAME: caputtar
DEFINITION: Capacity utilization target level
Parameter Explanation: Capacity utilization target level, expressed as a ratio. For example, a target level of 0.8 signifies that the capacity utilization should reach 80% of full use. Typically, this value would remain unchanged across all years.

NAME: carinit
DEFINITION: Carbon dioxide in atmosphere, base year
Parameter Explanation: Initial level of carbon dioxide in atmosphere in the base year, expressed in billion tons. The value in the model should be relatively accurate.

NAME: edprigndreqsur
DEFINITION: Education primary, gender equity time for survival
Parameter Explanation: Education primary, no of years (from firstyear) by which gender parity in primary survival rate is reached. The gender parity index is the ratio of the male rate to the female rate. Must set edgndreqsuron=1 for this to work.

NAME: carprein
DEFINITION: Carbon dioxide in atmosphere, pre-industrial
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that defines the pre-industrial atmospheric carbon levels, expressed in billion tons. Normally, a user will not change this parameter over time.

NAME: CBR
DEFINITION: Crude birthrate

NAME: xfdifinm
DEFINITION: Foreign direct investment (FDI), flow of investment from abroad, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on annual FDI invesment inflows. A value of 1 implies no change.

NAME: CDALF
DEFINITION: Cobb-Douglas alpha

NAME: cdmf
DEFINITION: Civilian damage factor in war; portion of economy
Parameter Explanation: Civilian damage factor.  This reactivity parameter links the severity of conventional war and the power of the opposing alliance to civilian damage (both population killed and economic capital destroyed).  A value of 0 will uncouple conventional war from damage and a value of 1 will make damage proportional to the war severity and opposing power.  There is no comparable parameter for the impact of nuclear war on civilians because the model always assumes civilian damage; in fact, it extends some such damage beyond the regions involved in nuclear war to third party countries (from fall-out and other collateral damage).

NAME: CDR
DEFINITION: Crude death rate

NAME: CIVDM
DEFINITION: Civilian damage from war;mult for pop & capital stock

NAME: CLAVAL
DEFINITION: Calories available

NAME: CLD
DEFINITION: Cost of land development

NAME: CLNEED
DEFINITION: Calories needed

NAME: clnf
DEFINITION: Calorie needs adjustment, for age distribution
Parameter Explanation: Calorie need factor or multiplier on calorie needs, by region. Usually set at 1. It adjusts regional calorie requirements to address food shortages impacting infant mortality. A value of 0 turns off the feedback between food shortages and infant mortality for a region.

NAME: clsexp
DEFINITION: Calorie shortage link to starvation, exponent (higher value lowers starvation)
Parameter Explanation: Exponent parameter that links calorie shortage to starvation. Higher values lower starvation and lower values increase starvation.

NAME: xwbsectar
DEFINITION: World Bank sector target, shares in percent (normalized)
Parameter Explanation: World Bank Sector Target, Shares in Percent.

NAME: XWBFLOWS
DEFINITION: Flows of funds from the World Bank to domestic purposes/agents

NAME: GINIDOM
DEFINITION: Domestic GINI index of inequality (larger is more unequal, from 0 to 1)
Parameter Explanation: No longer used as a parameter (is computed as a variable).  See, instead, incshrm.

NAME: HHPOP
DEFINITION: Household population size, by skill level

NAME: HDI21STFIX
DEFINITION: Human development index, fixed but higher maximums for the 21st century

NAME: hdilifemaxf
DEFINITION: Life expectancy maximum for 21st century HDI calculation, fixed
Parameter Explanation: Life expectancy minimum for HDI calculation, in years.  Users may change the parameter to represent growing life expectancy.

NAME: XFINUNEXP
DEFINITION: Unexplained financial imbalance

NAME: AIDSDTHSCM
DEFINITION: AIDS deaths cumulative since first model year, millions

NAME: hivpeakyr
DEFINITION: HIV, year of epidemic peak
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that specifies the peak year of HIV infection. It controls the year in which the rate of infection in a population reaches its peak, before the epidemic begins to wane.

NAME: infratelecostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Telephone connection cost, global lower bound

NAME: infratelecostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Telephone connection cost, global upper bound

NAME: infratelelife
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Telephone, fixed connection, lifetime

NAME: ictbroadmobilcostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, broadband  mobile connection cost, global upper bound

NAME: watsafecostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water connection cost, global lower bound

NAME: watsafecostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water connection cost, global upper bound

NAME: watsafecostm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water, multiplier on cost of adding an improved connection to a household

NAME: watsafelife
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Water, safe water connection, lifetime

NAME: GOVRISK
DEFINITION: Performance and Risk Index (0 represents less risk 1 represents more risk)
Parameter Explanation: The Risk Index is a weigthed average of the contribution to risk of a set of aproximately 20 variables. Each variable can contribute from 0 to 1 depending on where its value sits in the Minimum to Maximum range.

NAME: WATWASTE
DEFINITION: Wastewater collection system, percentage of people connected to

NAME: watwastem
DEFINITION: Wastewater collection system, percentage of people connected to, multiplier

NAME: ictbroadfromtelem
DEFINITION: ICT Broadband From Telephone multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for proportion of fixed telephone divestment that is used for fixed broadband

NAME: ictbroadmobilm
DEFINITION: ICT Mobile Broadband multiplier

NAME: ensolfueltrgtval
DEFINITION: Solid Fuel Use Elimination Target Value
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the target value of percentage of people using solid fuel.

NAME: NUMNWPGR
DEFINITION: Number of networked persons, growth rate

NAME: ENVPM2PT5
DEFINITION: Urban-population weighted PM2.5 levels in residential areas of cities with more than 100,000 residents

NAME: HDI
DEFINITION: Human development index, UN Development Program's measure

NAME: enml
DEFINITION: Energy import limit
Parameter Explanation: Energy import limit, expressed in billion barrels of oil equivalent functions both as a switch and a numerical value, with 0 indicating no limit and positive values setting a specific limit. Positive values (above .001) limit imports to the value specified.  For instance, a specification for a country of 0 for the first five years, 2 for the next three, and 0 thereafter,  introduces a constrain on imports of two billion barrels per year during the sixth, seventh, and eighth years.  Restrictions of this kind are more often posed by exporters (see enxl) than importers.

NAME: democimpoth
DEFINITION: Democracy impetus from non-specific forces, 1-10 (10=most); Polity scale
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the democracy impetus from non-specific forces such as the spread of a systemic value around democracy. The scale ranges from 1-10 (10=most) and is based on the Polity scale.  Normally interventions with the parameter would be variable over time (e.g., increasing gradually).

NAME: democimpusn
DEFINITION: Democracy impetus from US, neutral level, 1-10 (10=most); Polity scale
Parameter Explanation: The neutral or normal level of democracy impetus coming from US or other (e.g., EU) leadership.  The scale ranges from 1-10 (10=most) and is based on the Polity democracy scale.   Interventions with the parameter would be very uncommon and would normally change its value for all points in time.

NAME: eldemocimp
DEFINITION: Elasticity of democracy levels with leadership
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of democracy levels with systemic leadership.  That is, the responsiveness of democracy in a country to the impetus towards democracy provided by countries/regions such as the EU or the U.S.

NAME: malemigr
DEFINITION: Male migration as a portion of total migration
Parameter Explanation: Male migration as a portion of total migration.  This parameter is expressed as a ratio value, so that .47 would mean 47%.

NAME: livhdpro
DEFINITION: Livestock herd productivity gain with grain feeding
Parameter Explanation: Represents the productivity gains in livestock herds due to grain feeding, functioning as a multiplier-index. Normally, users should adjust this value gradually, starting with the initial value.

NAME: aiddon
DEFINITION: Aid (foreign) donations as % of GDP
Parameter Explanation: Aid (foreign) donations as % of GDP.  A coefficient of foreign assistance, by country/region.  It is in percentage form and is the percentage of GDP given in foreign aid (e.g., -0.2 equals 0.2 percent of GDP).

NAME: squeez
DEFINITION: Switch for energy shortage economic impact
Parameter Explanation: A switch that squeezes economic production when there are energy shortages (IFs does not force equilibration between energy supply and demand in any given time period, but seeks it over time; thus in the case of severe supply constraints, such as export limits by OPEC, actual shortages can appear).  A value of 0 turns off the linkage and the normal value of 1 activates it.  Other positive values also turn on the switch.  A value of 2 would make the impact of a shortage twice as great as normal and a value of 0.5 would cut it in half.

NAME: carabr
DEFINITION: Carbon (atmospheric) absorbed yearly by oceans and non-forest land sources
Parameter Explanation: Rate of carbon absorption - this parameter defines the amoung of atmospheric carbon (expressed in billion tons) that oceans or other sinks (except forests) absorb each year. Although this value should ultimately be a function of the carbon in the atmosphere and the carbon in the sinks of the ocean, land, and biological systems (and hence a computed variable), it is common in atmospheric models to specify it as a single, constant parameter.

NAME: CARANN
DEFINITION: Annual carbon emissions from fossil fuels

NAME: carbtax
DEFINITION: Carbon tax
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that sets the carbon tax, expressed in dollars/ton of carbon generated and affects (increases) energy prices and (decreases) demand. Values will normally be above 50 and as an example, a value of 100 ($100/ton) will add about $0.20 to the price of a gallon of gas.

NAME: carforst
DEFINITION: Carbon sequestered by forests, gigatons per million hectaresx
Parameter Explanation: Carbon generated by deforestation - this parameter specifies the amount of atmospheric carbon (expressed in billion tons) that will be added by deforestation (expressed in billion hectares of land). Normally you would not change this parameter over time, because it should be a fairly fixed parameter.

NAME: carfuel1
DEFINITION: Carbon generated by burning oil
Parameter Explanation: Carbon generated by burning oil, expressed in billion tons per billion barrels of oil equivalent.  Although this is an empirical value, it is possible that some advance technologies might sequester rather than release carbon into the atmosphere.

NAME: carfuel2
DEFINITION: Carbon generated by burning natural gas
Parameter Explanation: Carbon generated by burning natural gas expressed in billion tons per billion barrels of oil equivalent .  Although this is an empirical value, it is possible that some advance technologies might sequester rather than release carbon into the atmosphere.

NAME: carfuel3
DEFINITION: Carbon generated by burning coal
Parameter Explanation: Carbon generated by burning coal expressed in billion tons per billion barrels of oil equivalent.  Although this is an empirical value, it is possible that some advance technologies might sequester rather than release carbon into the atmosphere.

NAME: xhw
DEFINITION: eXport propensity, inertial delay in change
Parameter Explanation: Export propensity, inertial delay in change.  This parameter computes a moving average of export propensity.  A value of 0.7 would weight the historical or moving average by 0.7 and the newly computed value by 0.3 (1-0.7).

NAME: wpally
DEFINITION: World politics, reduction of dispute threat with alliance in dyad
Parameter Explanation: World politics, reduction of dispute threat with alliance in dyad.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute.  That is, -0.1 would indicate that being in an alliance would reduce the probability of a dispute between two states by 0.1%, all else being equal.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: XS
DEFINITION: eXports by sector

NAME: xshift
DEFINITION: eXport shift as result of promotion of exports
Parameter Explanation: Export shift.  An additive parameter that allows increase (positive values) or decrease (negative values) of exports of materials, manufactured goods, and services, by region.  Changes will be offset automatically by changes in private and governmental consumption.  This variable can be used to implement export-led growth strategies.  The model bases each year's exports on the proportion of its product exported the previous year, so a value of 0.05 would add 5 percent to exports for that and subsequent years.  Because the impact is cumulative, values should seldom exceed 0.1.  The initial values of trade represent data, so xshift should be changed from zero only after the initial year.

NAME: YL
DEFINITION: Yield in agriculture

NAME: hdiedsleminun
DEFINITION: Education, school life expectancy, minimum for HDI, set by UNDP
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the minimum school life expectancy in education, used for calculation of education component in HDI. Users will normally not change this parameter.

NAME: ylexp
DEFINITION: Yields (agricultural), exponent controlling saturation speed
Parameter Explanation: Agricultural yields' exponent controlling saturation speed represents a slowdown in the rate of yield increases as they approach the maximum (ylmax), ensuring a gradual, asymptotic approach to the yield ceiling.

NAME: ASALABGRRB
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, gross rebound with labor force growth

NAME: ASAPOPGRRB
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, gross rebound with population growth

NAME: ASAGDPCUMCHG
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative percentage change in GDP

NAME: ASAPOPCUMCHG
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative percentage change in population

NAME: ASALABCUMCHG
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative percentage change in labor

NAME: INDIRECTTAX
DEFINITION: Indirect taxes (taxes on goods and services)

NAME: INDIRECTTAXR
DEFINITION: Indirect taxes (taxes on goods and services), percent of firm income

NAME: indirecttaxrm
DEFINITION: Indirect tax rate multipler
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government taxes imposed on both households and firms for social security and welfare, expressed without units and by region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase taxes and lower values decrease them.

NAME: XFDISTOCK
DEFINITION: FDI (foreign direct investment) stock

NAME: ehw
DEFINITION: Energy historical weight factor for impact of prices on demand
Parameter Explanation: Energy historical weight factor for impact of prices on demand.  This parameter controls the speed at which changes in energy prices effect demand.  Values near 1.0 imply very rapid adjustment and values near 0 imply little or no adjustment.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: envylchgm
DEFINITION: Agricultural Annual Yield Change multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for the annual change in agricultural yield by country/region.

NAME: EDPRISUR
DEFINITION: Education, primary, survival rate, percentage of entering pupils reaching last grade

NAME: TES
DEFINITION: Total environmental stress

NAME: GLOBALIZ
DEFINITION: Globalization level index, base years values from 0-100 (highest)

NAME: VADDHHU
DEFINITION: Value added in sectors by unskilled households

NAME: XWBLOANS
DEFINITION: Loans from the World Bank, cumulative

NAME: XIMFCREDIT
DEFINITION: Credits from the IMF, cumulative

NAME: VADDF
DEFINITION: Value added in sectors by firms

NAME: CSHHS
DEFINITION: Consumption (household) in sectors by skilled households

NAME: CSHHU
DEFINITION: Consumption (household) in sectors by unskilled households

NAME: EDPRIGRADS
DEFINITION: Education, primary, number of graduates, gross

NAME: EDPRITOT
DEFINITION: Education, primary, total students, gross

NAME: hltechbase
DEFINITION: Technological Factor when not using low income model and for high income countries
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the technological factor when not using the low income model, instead only for high income countries.

NAME: hlobsw
DEFINITION: Relationship between Obesity and Cardiovascular Diseases (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the effect on cardiovascular diseases when obesity changes from the expected values.

NAME: hlsmimpsw
DEFINITION: Smoking Impact Switch (1=On, 0=Off), when off SI stays constant after 2030
Parameter Explanation: This switch is used to turn off the estimation of Smoking Impact, thus keeping the values constant after 2030. The GBD original forecast goes only until 2030.

NAME: hlvehsw
DEFINITION: Traffic Accident Deaths Modification Switch (1=On, 0=Off), when on uses Smeed's Law
Parameter Explanation: Switch used to turn off the estimation of Smoking Impact, thus keeping the values constant after 2030. The GBD original forecast goes only until 2030.

NAME: edexptconv
DEFINITION: Education ter expenditure per student as % of gdppc convergence time to function
Parameter Explanation: Tertiary per student expenditure as % of gdppc convergence time to function in years.  In the base case a shift from the function will be maintained because of the high convergence time.Scenarios with low convergence time make the per student cost rich those of high income countries as countries get richer. This increase in per student cost can come from lower pupil-teacher ratio, higher teacher salary and higher non-teacher salary portion of the cost.

NAME: elhlmortspn
DEFINITION: Elasticity of mortality by type to health care expenditures
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of mortality by type (Health Module Mortality) to health care expenditures.

NAME: ylhw
DEFINITION: Yields (agricultural), inertial delay in change
Parameter Explanation: Exponent controlling saturation speed of agricultural yields.  This parameter computes a moving average of export propensity.  A value of 0.2 would weight the new value by 0.2 and the historical or moving average by 1-0.2 or 0.8.  This parameter helps maintain behavioral stability in the face of yields that may begin to reach their maximum (see ylmax and ylexp).

NAME: ylm
DEFINITION: Yields (agricultural), multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on agricultureal yields, by region. It is used to represent potential yield changes due to technological or environmental factors. The value is typically adjusted over time rather than in the initial year. For example, a value of 1 represents no change, 1.25 represents a 25 percent increase and .75 represents a 25 percent decrease.

NAME: LVHERD
DEFINITION: Livestock herd

NAME: TGRYL
DEFINITION: Target growth in agricultural yield
Parameter Explanation: No longer used as a parameter, rather computed only.  See ylm and mfpadd.  The values are in decimal terms, so that a value of 0.001 would convey a rate of 1%.

NAME: THREAT
DEFINITION: Threat index as probability (in percentage terms) of militarized dispute

NAME: mfpleadr
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity growth rate of system leader
Parameter Explanation: Multifactor productivity growth rate of system leader.  This parameter is a powerful mechanism by which the user can increase or decrease the growth rate of productivity of the systemic leader (historically the U.S.).  Such changes pass through to assumptions of the rate of productivity growth in all other countries of the system.  A value of 0.01 introduces a rate of productivity growth of 1.0% annually in the systemic leader.

NAME: tmortr
DEFINITION: Trend of mortality reduction with time and technology
Parameter Explanation: Time-related reduction in mortality, in portion per year (i.e., .01 represents 1 percent).  Although time-related, it is obviously meant to represent the affect of technological advance on life expectancy.  This parameter is global, and you will often prefer to use mortm to introduce scenarios around mortality and life expectancy, because that parameter is country/region specific.

NAME: TRADEBAL
DEFINITION: Trade balance

NAME: GOVHHPENT
DEFINITION: Government to household transfers for pensions, total

NAME: ASAGDPDMAT
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative dematerialization in ratio to GDP

NAME: ASALABDMAT
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative dematerialization in ratio to labor

NAME: ASAPOPDMAT
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative dematerialization in ratio to population

NAME: ASARAWDMAT
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, cumulative dematerialization in raw values

NAME: wpgreat2
DEFINITION: World politics, increment of dispute probability in dyad with two great powers
Parameter Explanation: World politics, increment of dispute probability in dyad with two great powers.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute and is applied when at both members of the dyad are great powers (see wpgreatthesh and wpgreatlev for definitions of great power).  That is, 2.0 would indicate that the existence of two great powers would increase the probability of a dispute between two states by 2.0%, all else being equal.   Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).  This addition would be on top of the increment already added for the presence of one great power in a dyad (see wpgreat1).

NAME: POP
DEFINITION: Population

NAME: INFRAELECGENCAP
DEFINITION: Electricity generation capacity per person

NAME: INFRAELECGENCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity, cost of adding a kilowatt of generation capacity with associated network cost

NAME: WATSAFECOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water, cost of adding an improved connection to a household

NAME: ICTBROADCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, ICT, broadband, cost of adding a new broadband connection

NAME: ICTMOBILCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, ICT, mobile, cost of adding a subscriber

NAME: INFRATELECOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, ICT, telephone, cost of adding a fixed line

NAME: SANITATIONCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, Sanitation, cost of adding improved sanitation facilities to a household

NAME: HHSIZE
DEFINITION: Household size, numbe of people in a household

NAME: INFRAINVESTNEW
DEFINITION: Infrastructure investment needed, new construction

NAME: INFRAINVESTMAINT
DEFINITION: Infrastructure investment needed, maintenance

NAME: GDPP
DEFINITION: Gross domestic product at PPP

NAME: GDPPC
DEFINITION: GDP per capita

NAME: GDPPCP
DEFINITION: GDP per capita at PPP (2017 Thousand US Dollars)

NAME: rdinr
DEFINITION: Rate of discovery of energy, basic annual increment
Parameter Explanation: Rate of discovery of energy, basic annual increment.  This parameter determines the basic rate of additions to initial annual rates of fossil fuel discoveries.  That rate may not persist, however, because as resource bases near exhaustion, they gradually constrain discovery rates.

NAME: hlhivartm
DEFINITION: Population covered by HIV antiretroviral drugs multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the availability of HIV Anti-Retroviral Therapy.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlmalariaincm
DEFINITION: Malaria, annual incidence multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on malaria incidence.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlmalariaprevm
DEFINITION: Malaria, prevalence multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on malaria prevalence.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlmalariamortm
DEFINITION: Malaria, mortality multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on malaria mortality.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlhivincm
DEFINITION: HIV, annual incidence multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on HIV incidence. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlhivprevm
DEFINITION: HIV, prevalence multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on HIV prevalence.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: hlhivmortm
DEFINITION: HIV, annual mortality multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on HIV mortality. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: wtempadd
DEFINITION: Addition to calculated global temperature
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that sets the additive factor to the calculated global temperature.

NAME: co2perm
DEFINITION: Atmospheric percentage of CO2 multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on atmospheric percentage of CO2.

NAME: HLCONDOMUSE
DEFINITION: Condom use by 15-24 year old males at last high-risk sex

NAME: HLHIVINCPREVR
DEFINITION: Ratio of HIV incidence to prevalence

NAME: HLHIVMORTPREVR
DEFINITION: Ratio of HIV mortality to prevalence

NAME: HLMALINCPREVR
DEFINITION: Ratio of malaria incidence to prevalence

NAME: HLMALMORTPREVR
DEFINITION: Ratio of malaria mortality to prevalence

NAME: HLMALPREVPOPR
DEFINITION: Ratio of malaria prevalence to population

NAME: hlcondomusem
DEFINITION: Condom use 15-24 year-old males in high-risk sex, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the use of condoms among 15-24 year olds in high risk-sex cases. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: cconstsw
DEFINITION: Consumption Constant Switch (1 is on, 0 is off)
Parameter Explanation: Consumption constant switch, with 1 indicating on and 0 indicating off.

NAME: rdm
DEFINITION: Rate of discovery of energy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Energy reserve discovery multiplier, unit-less.  This parameter normally has a value of 1.  A value of 1.5 would increase annual fossil fuel discoveries by 50 percent (within the limit of ultimate resources, but without additional investment in energy discovery), while a value of 0.5 would decrease it by 50 percent.

NAME: reac
DEFINITION: Reactivity of countries to threat from each other, military spending
Parameter Explanation: Reactivity (Actor, Target).  This parameter determines the magnitude of the threat felt by a target in response to changing power balances with respect to an actor.  A value of 1.5 means that the perceived threat shifts 50 percent faster than the power balance, while a value of .5 means that threat rises only 50 percent as fast.  The user should be aware, however, that in the calculation of how threat affects defense spending, reactivities to ALL actors will shape a country's/region's expenditures, thus often diffusing sensitivity to changes in power of only a single external actor.  By setting reac for all actors towards a target to 0.0, then focusing the attention of a target on a single actor (e.g. reac(Russia, China) = 1.0), you can eliminate that diffusion of attention.

NAME: gdprext
DEFINITION: GDP growth rate, exogenous target (percent); use with gdpadjsw=0
Parameter Explanation: Computed in the preprocessor to set economic growth rates exogenously in early model years; it should be set to 0 when using gdpadjsw to determine growth.

NAME: nmilf
DEFINITION: Nuclear force military spending, portion of total spending
Parameter Explanation: Nuclear military expenditure factor.  A coefficient determining what portion of a country's or region's military expenditure is devoted to nuclear weapons, including delivery systems.  For instance, 0.1 would result in 10 percent.  This can be changed over time and could be used to convert a traditionally nuclear-free region into a nuclear power.  Normal values will range from 0 to 0.2.

NAME: NPOW
DEFINITION: Nuclear military power

NAME: contrusm
DEFINITION: Contraception use multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Contraception use multiplier.  A multiplier on contraception use, by region.  It normally has a value of 1.  Higher values increase contraception use and lower values decrease it.

NAME: CPOW
DEFINITION: Conventional military power

NAME: cpowdf
DEFINITION: Conventional power, damage done by war
Parameter Explanation: Conventional power damage factor.  This reactivity parameter links the severity of conventional war and the power of the opposing alliance to the losses of conventional power (personnel and equipment).  A value of 0 will uncouple conventional war from damage and a value of 1 will make damage proportional to the war severity and power of the opponents.

NAME: cpowf
DEFINITION: Conventional power, factor controlling conversion of military spending

NAME: CRA
DEFINITION: Consumption (household) ratio to household income

NAME: CS
DEFINITION: Consumption (household) by sector

NAME: CURACT
DEFINITION: Current account

NAME: CWAR
DEFINITION: Conventional war (0=no;1=yes)

NAME: cwarbase
DEFINITION: Conventional war, base probability (percentage terms, 0-100)
Parameter Explanation: Conventional warfare base probability - the model adds or substracts from this value incremental probabilities of war that depend on many factors (power balances, democracy levels, etc.).  Specify values between 0 and 1 for the base annual probability of war between any actor and target.  Normally the values should be quite near 0 and in the base case all values are set to zero.

NAME: cwarf
DEFINITION: Conventional war switch (>100=on, if WarOn = 1)
Parameter Explanation: Conventional war factor.  If WarOn = 1, by setting the value of this parameter equal to 100 or more you can force the model to generate a wide-spread war. Use of this parameter is only recommended for testing the functioning of war in the model; it has no policy interpretation.

NAME: CWARPB
DEFINITION: Conventional war probability (percentage terms, 0-100)

NAME: cwarsv
DEFINITION: Conventional war severity; portion of weaponry used
Parameter Explanation: Conventional war severity factor.  This coefficient determines what portion of the conventional armament potential will be used when a war erupts.  Values should range from 0 (none) to 1 (all).

NAME: DEATHS
DEFINITION: Deaths

NAME: dkl
DEFINITION: Depreciation coefficient for agricultural land investment
Parameter Explanation: Depreciation coefficient for agricultural land investment.  This scalar (not specific to country/region) indicates the portion (e.g., 0.01 is 1%) of the investment in agricultural land (e.g. terracing or irrigation) that depreciates in a given year.  Raising it would lead to greater requirements of agricultural investment in land to maintain that land in production.

NAME: enprixi
DEFINITION: Exogenous initial or equilibium base energy price when set above 0.0
Parameter Explanation: Energy base equilibium price in dollars per barrel of oil equivalent, by region.  Energy price (ENPRI) is normally computed relative to a price given in the initial or base year.  If that price is consdered far from long-term equilibirum, this parameter can overide it endogenously.  If you set enprixi to positive, nonzero values, you can override the initial oil price with your own price level.

NAME: drcpow
DEFINITION: Depreciation rate of conventional power
Parameter Explanation: Annual depreciation rate of conventional power (coefficient).  It is in proportional terms so that 0.1 represents 10% depreciation annually.  High values could simulate arms control agreements that resulted in destruction of weapons.

NAME: drnpow
DEFINITION: Depreciation rate of nuclear power
Parameter Explanation: Annual depreciation rate of nuclear power (coefficient).  It is in proportional terms so that 0.1 represents 10% depreciation annually.  High values could simulate arms control agreements that resulted in destruction of weapons.

NAME: dstl
DEFINITION: Desired stock (inventory) level in the economy
Parameter Explanation: Desired level of stock or inventory within the economy, represented as a percentage. A value of 0.1, for instance, indicates a target stock level of 10% relative to the base case that often includes annual production and may also encompass demand, exports, or imports.

NAME: dstlen
DEFINITION: Desired energy stock level as portion of stock base
Parameter Explanation: Desired energy stock level as portion of stock base.  It is in proportional terms so that 0.2 represents a 20% target stock level (of a base that usually includes annual production and may include demand, exports, or imports).  There is little reason for most users to want to change this parameter.

NAME: elinst1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of sectoral investment to stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of sectoral investment to stock level.  Elinst1 and elinst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elinst2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of sectoral investment to change in stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of sectoral investment to changes in stock level.  Elinst1 and elinst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: ellvhpr1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of livestock herd size to stock leve
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of livestock herd size to stock level.  Ellvhpr1 and ellvhpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: ellvhpr2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of livestock herd size to changes in stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of livestock herd size to changes in stock level.  Ellvhpr1 and ellvhpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elmpr1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of imports to price
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of imports to price.  Elmpr1 and elmpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elmpr2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of imports to change in price
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of imports to changes in price.  Elmpr1 and elmpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elasit
DEFINITION: Elasticity of total domestic demand to stocks/inventories
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of total domestic demand to stocks/inventories. Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elasmd
DEFINITION: Elasticity of meat demand to prices
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of meat demand to prices.  Values (normally negative) near 0 imply little responsiveness of demand to prices and larger absolute values (near -1) imply considerable responsiveness.  This value normally will not change much over time.  Significant changes in the value from specification in the base case could lead to difficulties or instability in market clearing (balancing of supply and demand).

NAME: elass
DEFINITION: Elasticity of energy supply to profit
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy supply with price change, by region and energy type.  There is tremendous uncertainty about these numbers.  Higher numbers will increase the responsiveness of energy supply to increased prices and lower numbers will decrease that responsiveness.  The elasticities actually work on energy investment and therefore only indirectly (and with a time delay) on energy supply.

NAME: elaszs
DEFINITION: Elasticity of capacity utilization to stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of capacity utilization to stock/inventory level.  This is an adjustment parameters (not a true elasticity). Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior. This parameter is global in nature, and not currently active.

NAME: elenpr
DEFINITION: Elasticity of energy investment to inventory level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy investment to inventory level.  Elenpr and elenpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elenpr2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of energy investment to change in inventory level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy investment to change in inventory level.  Elenpr and elenpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elerca1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of exchange rate to capital account/GDP ratio
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of exchange rate to capital account/GDP ratio.  Elerca1 and elerca2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elerca2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of exchange rate to change in capital account/GDP
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of exchange rate to change in capital account/GDP ratio.  Elerca1 and elerca2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: HHSAV
DEFINITION: Household savings, by skill level

NAME: FIRMSAV
DEFINITION: Firm savings

NAME: FORSAVRPA
DEFINITION: Foreign savings (relative price adjusted)

NAME: ictmobilteclowrt
DEFINITION: Minimum Growth in Technological factor for Mobile Phone Access.

NAME: ictmobiltecinflection
DEFINITION: Penetration Rate at which Growth in Technological factor starts to decrease for Mobile Phone Access.

NAME: ictbroadm
DEFINITION: ICT Broadband multiplier

NAME: vehicflpcm
DEFINITION: Vehicle fleet per capita, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on vehicles per capita by country/region.  A value of 1.0 leaves vehicles per capita unchanged.  An increase over time to 2.0 would double vehicles per capita relative to the base case.

NAME: deathtrpvm
DEFINITION: Deaths from traffic per vehicle multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on deaths from traffic accidents per vehicle. A value of 1 leaves values unchanged, while a value of 2 would double death per vehicle relatibe to the base case.

NAME: hlmorttranssw
DEFINITION: Mortality Transition Switch (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: Switch for mortality transition. When  Low Income countries make the transition from low-income to high income mortality, i.e. they start moving towards the high income regression for mortality.

NAME: HLSTUNT
DEFINITION: Stunting Rate (Percentage of the Total Population that is affected by childhood malnutrition).
Parameter Explanation: The percentage of the total population that is affected by childhood malnutrition

NAME: mfpstunt
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to Stunting
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to stunting.

NAME: mfphlyld
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to years of life lost to disability
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to years of life lost to disability.

NAME: ENVTPCHG
DEFINITION: Annual Average Temperature Change from 1990
Parameter Explanation: The average annual temperature change from 1990 by country/region

NAME: watsafem
DEFINITION: Water source safe, percentage of people with access to, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier for the percentage of People living with different levels of Access to Safe Water

NAME: tmortr2
DEFINITION: Trend of mortality reduction with time and technology, LDC catch-up
Parameter Explanation: Time-related reduction in mortality, in portion per year (i.e., .01 represents 1 percent). See and compare with tmortr; this represents catch-up in fertility reduction by poor countries using tech transfer.  Although time-related, it is obviously meant to represent the affect of technological advance on life expectancy.  This parameter is global, and you will often prefer to use mortm to introduce scenarios around mortality and life expectancy, because that parameter is country/region specific.

NAME: edprilen
DEFINITION: Education, primary, duration of primary
Parameter Explanation: Duration of education, primary is the number of grades (years) in primary education, aggregation rule for group might result in non-integer values

NAME: edpristart
DEFINITION: Education, primary, entrance age to primary
Parameter Explanation: Entrance age in primary education, aggregation rule for group might result in non-integer values

NAME: enresunce
DEFINITION: Energy resources unconventional, portion economic to produce

NAME: EDTERENRG
DEFINITION: Education, tertiary, gross enrolment rate

NAME: ensfvent
DEFINITION: Ventilation coefficient

NAME: hlsolfuelsw
DEFINITION: Relationship between Solid Fuel Use and Respiratory Diseases (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the effect on respiratory diseases (and infections) when solid fuel use changes from the expected values.

NAME: hlpm2pt5sw
DEFINITION: Relationship between Residential PM2.5 levels and Respiratory Diseases (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the effect on respiratory diseases and infections when residential PM2.5 level changes from the expected values.

NAME: ENVPRCHG
DEFINITION: Annual Average Precipitation Change from 1990
Parameter Explanation: The average annual precipitation change from 1990 by country/region

NAME: SANITATION
DEFINITION: Sanitation, improved, percent of population with access to

NAME: POP0TO5
DEFINITION: Population, aged 0 to 5

NAME: govconm
DEFINITION: Government consumption multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government consumption. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: HHDIVINT
DEFINITION: Household dividends and interest (from firms), by skill level

NAME: swingstsdem
DEFINITION: Swing state democracy effects from global, swing state, regional democracy
Parameter Explanation: Swing state democracy effects from global, swing state, and regional democracy levels.  These parameters have been estimated and you will seldom change them. Values of 0 turn off the respective effects.

NAME: swseffmax
DEFINITION: Swing State effects maximum annual magnitude (Polity points)
Parameter Explanation: Swing State effects maximum annual magnitude (Polity points).  Because the Polity democracy scale runs from 1-10 (10=most democratic), you would normally not set a value for this parameter of more than 2-4 points, and most often it would be considerably lower.

NAME: democimpus
DEFINITION: Democracy impetus by the US/other leadership, 1-10 (10=most); Polity scale
Parameter Explanation: Democracy impetus coming from US or other (e.g., EU) leadership.  Values are on a 1-10 (10=most) scale, related to the Polity democracy scale.  Normally interventions with the parameter would be variable over time (e.g., increasing gradually).

NAME: elfdpr1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of yield to stocks/inventories
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of yield to stocks/inventories.  Elfdpr1 and elfdpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elfdpr2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of yield to changes in stocks/inventories
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of yield to changes in stocks/inventories.  Elfdpr1 and elfdpr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: swseffects
DEFINITION: Swing State effects switch (1=On, 0=Off)
Parameter Explanation: Action-reaction switch.  A value of 1 (as in the base case) turns on an action-reaction dynamic in the determination of threat.  A value of 0 turns it off.

NAME: DEMOCEXP
DEFINITION: Democracy, expected (no empirical prior) - Polity project measure  (higher is more democratic; 0-20)

NAME: GINI
DEFINITION: Global GINI index of inequality across states (larger is more unequal, from 0 to 1)
Parameter Explanation: No longer used as a parameter (is computed as a variable).  See, instead, incshrm.

NAME: FIRMINC
DEFINITION: Firm income

NAME: POPGT65
DEFINITION: Population, aged more than 65 years

NAME: POPLE15
DEFINITION: Population, aged 15 years or less

NAME: POPR
DEFINITION: Population growth rate

NAME: POWERHH
DEFINITION: Power index, Hillebrand Herman (percent of global total)

NAME: PPPCONV
DEFINITION: Purchasing power parity conversion factor

NAME: FREEDOM
DEFINITION: Freedom House freedom indicator (higher is more democratic;2-14;reversed from Freedom House)

NAME: freedomm
DEFINITION: Freedom multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Freedom House's measure of freedom (FREEDOM), which combines civil and political scale ranging from 2 (most free) to 14 (least free). A value of 1 in the multiplier implies no change, while higher values increase the value of FREEDOM (making a country/region less free).

NAME: FSTOCK
DEFINITION: Food stocks

NAME: GDS
DEFINITION: Government expenditures by destination sector

NAME: GDP
DEFINITION: Gross domestic product

NAME: birthmshr
DEFINITION: Births, male share
Parameter Explanation: Births, male share.  Slightly more than 50% of births are males and more males die at most ages than do females.  This is an empirical value and you would normally not want to change it.

NAME: YTHBULGE
DEFINITION: Youth bulge indicator (15-29/all adults)

NAME: elasxinc
DEFINITION: Elasticity of exports with gross production of sector
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of exports to production and income level.  Values (normally positive) near 0  imply little change of exports with income and values near 1 imply that exports increase or decrease proportionally with income.  Normally, values should not be set far from 1.  These are used on  Materials, Manufactrues, ICT and Services sectors.

NAME: elasminc
DEFINITION: Elasticity of imports with income (demand base of sector)
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of imports to income level.  Values (normally positive) near 0 imply little change of imports with income and values near 1 imply that imports increase or decrease proportionally with income. Typically, values are not set far from 1. These are used on Sectors Materials, Manufactrues, ICT and Services.

NAME: MODYEARI
DEFINITION: Model, year initial

NAME: DEMOCPOLITY
DEFINITION: Democracy, Polity index  (Range: 0-20; higher is better)

NAME: democm
DEFINITION: Democracy multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the level of democracy, expressed without units and by region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, users should not generally  change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: POTSUPRAT
DEFINITION: Potential support ratio (15-64/65+)

NAME: IALK
DEFINITION: Investment in agriculture, land share

NAME: IDS
DEFINITION: Investment by destination

NAME: wvsagesw
DEFINITION: World Value Survey aging function switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch for World Value Survets aging.  The parameter controls the dynamics associated with the value orientation of cohorts in the model.  The standard value for it is 2, which results in the "aging" of value orientations.  That is, value orientation is calculated from GDP per capita only for the youngest cohort; all others carry their orientation forward in time.  Any other value for wvsagesw (the WVS aging switch) will result in use of the cohort-specific functions with GDP per capita.

NAME: carsm
DEFINITION: Car sales, multiplier by type
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on car sales by country/region and car type.  A value of 1.0 leaves car sales unchanged.  An increase over time to 2.0 would approximately double car sales of the specified type relative to the base case (total car sales will be normalized and therefore unchanged relative to the base case).

NAME: trucksm
DEFINITION: Truck sales by type, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on truck sales by country/region and truck type.  A value of 1.0 leaves truck sales unchanged.  An increase over time to 2.0 would approximately double truck sales of the specified type relative to the base case (total sales will be normalized and therefore unchanged relative to the base case).

NAME: infraelecaccm
DEFINITION: Electricity access, multiplier

NAME: infraroadpavedpcntm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, road network, percentage paved, multiplier

NAME: cultshmp
DEFINITION: Cultural region shift on materialism/postmaterialism
Parameter Explanation: Cultural shift on the materialism/post-materialism index.  It is an additive factor that represents the average "shift" in the index for materialism/post-materialism for a given cultural region (relative to what would be expected based of level of GDP per capita), as identified in the World Value Survey project.  The initial value is determined from data, but the user could change the value over time to represent cultural convergence or divergence.

NAME: cultshse
DEFINITION: Cultural region shift on survival/self-expression
Parameter Explanation: Cultural shift on the survival/self-expression index.  It is an additive factor that represents the average "shift" in the index for survival/self-expression for a given cultural region (relative to what would be expected based of level of GDP per capita), as identified in the World Value Survey project.  The initial value is determined from data, but the user could change the value over time to represent cultural convergence or divergence.

NAME: contiguity
DEFINITION: Contiguity (geographic proximity) of countries/regions
Parameter Explanation: The physical distance between two countries/reigons.  The scale is:  1=land contiguity; 2=0=12 miles; 3=12-24 miles; 4=24-150 miles; 5=150-400 miles; 6=more than 400 miles.  Normally you would not change this value over time.

NAME: GOVDEBT
DEFINITION: Solvency - government debt as percentage of GDP

NAME: govfinconv
DEFINITION: Government financial balances, convergence time to global functions
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the convergence time of government financial balances to its global function. Very often initial data values for countries will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

NAME: xfdistockm
DEFINITION: Foreign direct investment (FDI), stocks of investment from abroad, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Foreign Direct Investment Stocks of Investments from Abroad.

NAME: xportfoliom
DEFINITION: Portfolio investment (FDI), stocks of investment from abroad, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on International Portfolio Investment, Inward Stocks.

NAME: ximfcrfinm
DEFINITION: IMF credits (flows in), multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Credits from IMF, inflows.

NAME: xfdistoutm
DEFINITION: Foreign direct investment (FDI), stocks of investment to abroad, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Foreign Direct Investment (Outflows).

NAME: xportstoutm
DEFINITION: Portfolio investment (FDI), stocks of investment to abroad, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Portfolio Investment, outward stocks.

NAME: ximfcreqr
DEFINITION: IMF credit to equity ratio
Parameter Explanation: IMF Credit to Equity Ratio.

NAME: ximfcrrepr
DEFINITION: IMF credit repayment rate/time
Parameter Explanation: IMF credit repayment rate/time (Years).

NAME: ximfcrintr
DEFINITION: IMF credit interest rate
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Credits from IMF, outflows (Repayments).

NAME: ASAGDP
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, ratios to GDP

NAME: ASAPOP
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, ratios to population

NAME: ASALAB
DEFINITION: Advanced Sustainability Analysis, ratios to labor force

NAME: govexpm
DEFINITION: Government expenditures multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government expenditure by destination.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: govrevm
DEFINITION: Government revenues multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government revenues by destination. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: elgrevdebt1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of government revenues to government debt levels
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of government revenues to government debt levels.  Elprst1 and elprst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: wpgreatthresh
DEFINITION: World politics, systemic power share for threshhold great power status
Parameter Explanation: World politics, systemic power share for threshhold great power status.  The value is in percent of systemic power.  Thus 2.0 would indicate that a state was just beginning to be a great power when its share of total global power reached 2.0%. See also the level to be a full great power, wpgreatlev.

NAME: wpgreat1
DEFINITION: World politics, increment of dispute probability in dyad with one great power
Parameter Explanation: World politics, increment of dispute probability in dyad with one great power.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute and is applied when at least one member of the dyad is a great power (see wpgreatthesh and wpgreatlev for definitions of great power).  That is, 0.7 would indicate that the existence of one great power would increase the probability of a dispute between two states by 0.7%, all else being equal.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: PQLI
DEFINITION: Physical quality of life index

NAME: PRI
DEFINITION: Prices, index values

NAME: prodtf
DEFINITION: Production of energy, minimum reserve ratio
Parameter Explanation: Production of energy, minimum reserve ratio.  This value specifies the minimum number of years of reserves, at current rates of production, that can exist for any fossil energy fuel.  Thus a value of 10 would mean that when reserves dropped below 10 years of production, production would be cut to restore the minimum ratio.

NAME: lks
DEFINITION: Lifetime of capital by sector
Parameter Explanation: Lifetime of capital by sector, expressed in years.  You will normally only change this value slowly over time, maintaining the initial value.

NAME: tfrmin
DEFINITION: TFR (total fertility rate) stabilization level with high income
Parameter Explanation: TFR (total fertility rate) stabilization level with high income.  This is a very important parameter, because fertility rates in many developed countries have falled well below the 2.1 replacement level.  The level at which they stabilize for countries at the highest levels of income, and when they stabilize (you might change this over time), will greatly effect ultimate global population maximums and possible decline rates.

NAME: tfrconv
DEFINITION: TFR (total fertility rate) convergence time to expected value
Parameter Explanation: TFR (total fertility rate) convergence time to expected value.  Very often initial data values for countries will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

NAME: govhhtrnwelm

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government to household transfers for social welfare. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier

NAME: ethnic1

NAME: ethnic2

NAME: elenpst2

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy production to change in world inventory level.  Elenpst and elenpst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: eleniprof

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of energy investment to profit level.  Eleniprof and eleniprof2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

Parameter Explanation: War probability elasticity with global community.  This parameter and the underlying level of global community (GLOCOM) are not now being used in the calculation of threat.

NAME: eumembsw
DEFINITION: EU membership switch for caculations of power (0=none; 1= member)
Parameter Explanation: EU membership switch for caculations of power (0=none; 1= member).  The members of the European Union are, of course, known.  But as candidate members become full members, it would be appropriate to change the values of this parameter.

NAME: wpdemdist
DEFINITION: World politics, response of dispute threat to political distance
Parameter Explanation: World politics, response of dispute threat to political distance.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute and is applied to the absolute value of the distance in democracy level between the states in a dyad.  That is, 0.01 would indicate that every point of additional distance on the underlying Polity scale would increase the probability of a dispute between two states by 0.01%, all else being equal.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: wptrade
DEFINITION: World politics, change in dispute threat with systemic trade
Parameter Explanation: World politics, change in dispute threat with systemic trade.  The value is in percent. Thus -0.01% would indicate that the probability of a dispute between two states would fall by 0.01% for every percentage increase in world trade as a percent of global GDP.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: wpconmin
DEFINITION: World politics, minimum power concentration affecting dispute probability
Parameter Explanation: World politics, minimum power concentration affecting dispute probability.  This parameter bounds the power concentration range within which change affects dispute probability.

NAME: wpconmax

Parameter Explanation: World politics, maximum power concentration affecting dispute probability.  This parameter bounds the power concentration range within which change affects dispute probability.

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of livestock grazing intensity to prices.  Values (normally positive) near 0 would imply little change of grazing with livestock prices and values near 1 would imply that grazing increases or decreases proportionally with prices.

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of agricultural investment in land to economic return.  Eliasp1 and eliasp2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: eliasp2

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of agricultural investment in land to changes in economic return.  Eliasp1 and eliasp2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elinag1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of agricultural investment to profit
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of agricultural investment to profit.  Elinag1 and elinag2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elinag2

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of agricultural investment to changes in profit.  Elinag1 and elinag2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: enconv
DEFINITION: Energy demand convergence time to predicted values
Parameter Explanation: Energy demand convergence time to predicted values, in years.  Very often initial data values for countries, such as energy demand in this case, will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship or other relationship used in the model.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

NAME: ENDEM
DEFINITION: Energy demand

NAME: endemm
DEFINITION: Energy demand multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Energy demand multiplier.  A multiplier on energy demand, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase demand and lower values decrease it.

NAME: engel

Parameter Explanation: Engel elasticities in the LES system for personal consumption, impacting terms of trade and regional development. Values above 1 cause personal consumption demand within a sector to outpace total consumption growth, and vice versa for values below 1.

NAME: eninvm
DEFINITION: Energy investment multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Energy investment multiplier.  A multiplier on energy investment, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase investment and lower values decrease it.

NAME: ENM

NAME: enon
DEFINITION: Energy-economy linkage switch (On=1/Off=0)
Parameter Explanation: Energy switch.  This switch turns on or off the linkages between the energy submodel and all others, including economics.  When off, the economic model relies upon the simpler structure of its own energy sector.  The switch enon takes values only of 1 (on) and 0 (off).  It is often useful to disconnect submodels while exploring the behavior of any one.  The normal value is 1.

NAME: ENP
DEFINITION: Energy production

NAME: enpm
DEFINITION: Energy production multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Energy production multiplier.  A multiplier on all types of energy production, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase production and lower values decrease it.  Warning: no cost to increased production; see ENINVM and ENINVTM for parameters to shift investment and production with trade-offs.

NAME: ENPRI
DEFINITION: Energy price

NAME: enprix
DEFINITION: Exogenous energy price when set above 0.0
Parameter Explanation: Energy price in dollars per barrel of oil equivalent, by region.  Energy price (ENPRI) is normally computed endogenously so as to balance supply and demand of energy.  If you set enprix to positive, nonzero values, you can override the endogenous computation with your own price level.  It is possible to intervene with energy prices only for select years by leaving enprix at zero for other years and specifying enprix only for selected ones.  You might do this, for instance, to represent a period in which government controls energy prices domestically or a cartel sets them internationally.

Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of government revenues to changed in government debt levels.  Elprst1 and elprst2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

DEFINITION: eXternal debt of firms (guaranteed and non-guaranteed), total
