NAME: mortconv
DEFINITION: Mortality, convergence time to expected value
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the convergence time of mortality to its expected value.  Very often initial data values for countries will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

NAME: mortm
DEFINITION: Mortality multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on mortality or death, by region and type. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase mortality and lower values decrease it.  Users would introduce an epidemic (like AIDS) by substantially increasing the value.  Scientific advance that greatly increased our age spans could be introduced by a value of 0.5 that is normally phased in.

NAME: MORTMG
DEFINITION: Mortality multiplier from government expenditures

NAME: lintr
DEFINITION: Loan interest rate, global
Parameter Explanation: Interest rate on international loans/indebtedness, expressed in the form of a ratio. For example, setting this parameter to 0.10 represents an interest rate of 10%.

NAME: LIT
DEFINITION: Literacy, percentage of population, 15 and older

NAME: lke
DEFINITION: Lifetime of energy capital
Parameter Explanation: Lifetime of energy capital, years.  You will normally only change this value slowly over time, maintaining the initial value.

NAME: INCOMELT200CS2005
DEFINITION: Population with income less than $2 per day, cross sectional computation  (using 2005 ICP based survey data)

NAME: INCOMELT125CS2005
DEFINITION: Population with income less than $1.25 per day, cross sectional computation (using 2005 ICP based survey data)

NAME: XPORTFOUT
DEFINITION: International portfolio investment (bonds and stocks), outward flows, billion currency

NAME: xportr
DEFINITION: International portfolio stocks, basic annual growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Basic Growth Rate on International Portfolio Investment, Inward Stocks.

NAME: xwbloanr
DEFINITION: World Bank loan portfolio, basic annual growth rate
Parameter Explanation: World Bank Loan Portfolio, Basic Annual Growth Rate.

NAME: ximfcreditr
DEFINITION: IMF credit, basic annual growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Percentage of new Credits open each year.

NAME: XWBLOANSTOT
DEFINITION: Total loan portfolio of the World Bank

NAME: glocom
DEFINITION: Global community multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Global community multiplier.  This global (not regional) parameter affects the probability of war  between any two geographic actors.   A value of 1 leaves the base probability unchanged.  A value of 1.5 would increase "community" by 50 percent and thereby decrease the probability of war by 50 percent.  A value of 0.5 would suggest a deterioration in global community.

NAME: nwarsv
DEFINITION: Nuclear war severity, portion of weapons used
Parameter Explanation: Nuclear war severity factor.  This coefficient determines what portion of the nuclear armament potential will be used when a war erupts.  Values should range from 0 (none) to 1 (all).

NAME: ofscth
DEFINITION: Ocean fish catch
Parameter Explanation: Total global ocean fish catch in million metric tons. This value is set exogenously and is typically not altered from the initial setting, except for future value changes.

NAME: QE
DEFINITION: Q (capital costs-to-output ratio)
Parameter Explanation: Capital output ratio for energy, in dollars, per barrel of production capacity, by region and energy category.  This variable determines how many dollars of capital are required in the production of a barrel of oil equivalent in each energy category.  It therefore represents the cost of energy production.  QE is exogenous only for nuclear and renewable energy.  Values for oil, gas, and coal are computed endogenously (and depend on remaining resources) and should be examined only as indicators.  To change the cost pattern for those energy forms, use resorm and increase or decrease resources.  Values for renewable and nuclear energy can be exogenously changed, but you should maintain the initial value of the base case.  A series of gradually lower costs could represent technological progress (e.g. in the solar component of renewable).  A series of gradually higher costs could represent the impact of environmental factors (e.g. increasing costs of nuclear waste disposal).  Higher or lower values will increase or decrease investment in a particular energy category and will affect its production level.  You should be aware that investment will respond only to changes over time in QE and not to changes in the initial condition.

NAME: qem
DEFINITION: Q (capital costs-to-output ratio) in energy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Capital output ratio for energy multiplier.  A multiplier on all types of energy capital output, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the amount of capital required per unit of energy output and lower values decrease it. Lower this parameter gradually over time to simulate a decreased cost of an energy form (such as renewable energy) as a result of technological advance.  Raise it over time to simulate the addition to the capital cost of an energy form (say nuclear) as a result of the addition to those costs of environmental ones.

NAME: rdi
DEFINITION: Rate of discovery for fossil fuels, initial
Parameter Explanation: Rate of discovery for fossil fuels, initial, billion barrels of oil equivalent.  Changes in this parameter only directly effect rates of discovery in the very first year; thereafter the rates are calculated.

NAME: tconr
DEFINITION: Time-related increase in contraception use
Parameter Explanation: This parameter specifies the increase in time-related contraception use, expressed in percentage terms.

NAME: envpm2pt5m
DEFINITION: Residential PM2.5 levels multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on the level of residential 2.5 air pollution.

NAME: trademax
DEFINITION: Trade, maximum as portion of tradable production base
Parameter Explanation: Maximum trade as a portion of tradable production base, expressed in decimal form. A value of 0.9 means 90%. Values can exceed 1.0 because some economies export and reexport more than they produce.

NAME: ttfrr
DEFINITION: Trend reduction in TFR (total fertility rate)
Parameter Explanation: Time-related reduction in total fertility rate (TFR), in portion per year (i.e., .01 represents 1 percent).  Although time-related, it is obviously meant to represent the affect of technological and or cultural/value-based change in fertility rates.  This parameter is global, and you will often prefer to use tfrm to introduce scenarios around fertility rates, because that parameter is country/region specific.  This parameter represents, however, the historic phenomenon of "systemic shift" in fertility rates.

NAME: VADD
DEFINITION: Value added in sectors

NAME: gdsm
DEFINITION: Government expenditures by destination multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government expenditure by destination.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: GLDCAP
DEFINITION: Grazing land capacity, MMT of grain equivalent

NAME: MS
DEFINITION: iMports by sector

NAME: KNOWSOC
DEFINITION: Knowledge society index; base year 0-100 (better)

NAME: ENRGDP
DEFINITION: Energy demand ratio to GDP

NAME: ENSHO
DEFINITION: Energy shortage

NAME: ENST
DEFINITION: Energy stocks

NAME: enxl
DEFINITION: Energy export limit
Parameter Explanation: Energy export limit, ex billion barrels of oil equivalent  functions both as a switch and a numerical value, with 0 indicating no limit and positive values setting a specific limit..  Positive values (above .001) limit exports to the value specified.  For instance, a specification for a country of 0 for the first five years, 2 for the next three, and 0 thereafter,  introduces a constrain on exports of two billion barrels per year during the sixth, seventh, and eighth years.  If placed on OPEC exports, such an export restriction would be very severe.

NAME: ENX
DEFINITION: Energy exports

NAME: epra
DEFINITION: Energy price responsiveness to stock/inventory levels
Parameter Explanation: Energy price responsiveness to stock/inventory levels.  Epra and eprafs are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities), most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: eprafs
DEFINITION: Energy price responsiveness to change in stock/inventory levels
Parameter Explanation: Energy price responsiveness to change in stock/inventory levels

NAME: MFPSC
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity contribution from social capital (incl goverance)

NAME: MFPPC
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity contribution from physical capital (incl infrastructure)

NAME: MFPKN
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity contribution from knowledge creation and diffusion

NAME: MFPTOT
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity contribution from all sources

NAME: EDPRIINTN
DEFINITION: Education, primary, intake rate adjusted net, entering age entrants (-1,0,+1) as % of entering age children

NAME: MFPCOR
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity, correction for empirical growth

NAME: MFPBAS
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity, systemic technology base

NAME: RANDDEXP
DEFINITION: Research and development spending portion of GDP

NAME: mfpenpri
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity with energy prices
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to energy prices.  Values (normally negative) near 0 imply little elasticity and values near -1  imply  considerable elasticity.

NAME: mfpedspn
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to education spending
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Multifactor Productivity Growth to an increase in education spending as a share of GDP.

NAME: mfphlspn
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to health spending
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Multifactor Productivity Growth to an increase in health spending as a share of GDP.

NAME: mfpedyrs
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to years of education at 15+
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Multifactor Productivity Growth  to an increase in years of education for adult population.

NAME: mfplife
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to life expectancy
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Multifactor Productivity Growth to an increase in life expectancy.

NAME: mfpefree
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to economic freedom
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Economic Freedom contribution to MFP.

NAME: mfpfree
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to freedom
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Freedom contribution to MFP.

NAME: mfpgoveff
DEFINITION: Elasticity of multifactor productivity to government effectiveness
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of Multifactor Productivity Growth to government effectiveness.

NAME: ENPRR
DEFINITION: Energy production growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Initial condition for rate of annual production growth.  Computed in the preprocessor, this initial condition heavily influences growth patterns.

NAME: salpha
DEFINITION: Sectorally-specific alpha in value added (capital's share)
Parameter Explanation: Sectorally-specific alpha in capital's share of value added.  This value has a general empirical base and users will not normally change it.

NAME: wpcontiguity
DEFINITION: World politics, response of dispute threat to geographic contiguity/proximity
Parameter Explanation: World politics, response of dispute threat to geographic contiguity/proximity.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute.  That is, 3.0 would indicate that being neighbors would increase the probability of a dispute between two states by 3.0%, all else being equal.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: cpowldcf
DEFINITION: Conventional power, higher impact of mil spending in LDCs
Parameter Explanation: Convention power factor representing less developed country (LDC) advantage in converting military expenditures to power ("bang for the buck").  Because of lower cost structures (as often represented by higher ratios in LDCs of GDP at purchasing power parity to  GDP at exchange rates) the same levels of military expenditures may provide greater contributions to conventional military power.  This parameter specifies the maximum relative advantage for the poorest LDCs (for instance, 2 equals twice as much power added for every dollar spent).  This parameter should probably be replaced by the typical ratio of GDP at purchasing power parity to GDP at exchange rates for a given GDP per capita.

NAME: cultshseload
DEFINITION: Cultural region shift on survival/self-expression load
Parameter Explanation: Cultural region shift on survival/self-expression load.  This parameter is computed and used in the "pre-processor" of the model. Therefore changes by the user will have no effect on the model.

NAME: POPFOREIGN
DEFINITION: Population, foreign born

NAME: INTR
DEFINITION: Interest rates

NAME: lifexpmin
DEFINITION: Life expectancy minimum for PQLI calculation
Parameter Explanation: This parameter determines the minimum life expectancy for PQLI calculation, expressed in years. Users will normally not change this parameter.

NAME: M
DEFINITION: iMports

NAME: MALNCHIL
DEFINITION: Malnourished children (under 5)

NAME: MALNCHP
DEFINITION: Malnourished children (under 5) as percent

NAME: FISH
DEFINITION: Fish production, ocean and mariculture

NAME: forestm
DEFINITION: Forest protection multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on forest area, by region, expressed without units. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase forest area and lower values decrease it.

NAME: FPRI
DEFINITION: Food prices

NAME: fpricr1
DEFINITION: Food prices, response to stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of food prices (crops) to stock level. Frpricr1 and fpricr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters, most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: fpricr2
DEFINITION: Food prices, response to change in stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of food prices (crops) to changes in stock level. Frpricr1 and fpricr2 are a pair of adjustment parameters, most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: econfreem
DEFINITION: Economic freedom multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on economic freedom, expressed without units and by region. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: encartpp
DEFINITION: Energy cartel price premium
Parameter Explanation: Energy cartel price premium.  This is a parameter (normally 0) that indicates the number of dollars/barrel that an energy cartel could add to global energy prices.  Normally a scenario using this parameter would introduced it for a specific period (e.g., 2020-2025) to represent a tight energy market allowing such a cartel to be effective, at least for a time.

NAME: keqshr
DEFINITION: (K)capital equipment share in fixed capital
Parameter Explanation: Share of capital equipment (K) in fixed capital.

NAME: NUMNWP
DEFINITION: Number of networked persons

NAME: XWORKREMIT
DEFINITION: Worker remittances (positive numbers are receipts)

NAME: meatmax
DEFINITION: Meat consumption, maximum per year per person (first year only).
Parameter Explanation: Maximum meat consumption per person, expressed in tons per person per year   limits meat consumption calculations for the initial year, in case of unreasonable data. If you wish to introduce scenarios around dietary patterns (for instance, to reduce meat consumption), use the parameter calmeatm.

NAME: NSGAPA
DEFINITION: North-South gap, absolute difference between GDPs/capita

NAME: nsdiv
DEFINITION: North-South dividing line, GDP per capita
Parameter Explanation: North-South dividing line, GDP per capita.  This parameter is only used in computing summary measures of the north-south gap in absolute or relative terms.

NAME: NSGAPR
DEFINITION: North-South gap, ratio of GDPs/capita - all rich over all poor

NAME: EDSECLOWRPER20TO24
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, lower secondary, percentage of youth (20 to 24 yrs) who completed lower secondary

NAME: EDSECUPPRPER20TO24
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, upper secondary, percentage of youth (20 to 24 yrs) who completed upper secondary

NAME: EDTERPER25TO29
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, tertiary, percentage of youth (25 to 29 years) who completed tertiary

NAME: EDPRIPERTOT
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, primary, percentage of adults (15+) who completed primary

NAME: EDSECLOWRPERTOT
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, lower secondary, percentage of adults (15+) who completed lower secondary

NAME: EDSECUPPRPERTOT
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, upper secondary, percentage of adults (15+) who completed upper secondary

NAME: EDTERPERTOT
DEFINITION: Education, total attainment, tertiary, percentage of adults (15+) who completed tertiary

NAME: edtergradtrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Tertiary, Graduation Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve 100% graduation rate in tertiary education.

NAME: edterinttrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Tertiary, Intake Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal intake rate in tertiary education.

NAME: taxinfadjm
DEFINITION: Taxrate adjustment from informal economy multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on tax rate adjustments because of the extent of informal economy. A value of 0 specifies no adjustment; while a value of 1 specifies full adjustment.

NAME: edpriintntrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Primary, Net Intake Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal net intake rate in primary education.

NAME: MIGRATE
DEFINITION: Migration rate(inward), net computed, percent of population

NAME: MIGRANTS
DEFINITION: Migrants (inward), net

NAME: fprihw
DEFINITION: Food prices, historic (inertial delay) in change
Parameter Explanation: Historic (inertial delay) change in food prices. Values close to 1 imply very rapid adjustment and values near 0 imply little or no adjustment.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: fprimt1
DEFINITION: Food prices (meat), response to stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of food prices (meat) to stock level. Fprimt1 and fprimt2 are a pair of adjustment parameters, most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: fprimt2
DEFINITION: Food prices (meat), response to changes in stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of food prices (meat) to changes in stock level. Fprimt1 and fprimt2 are a pair of adjustment parameters, most of which normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: FPROFITR
DEFINITION: Food profit ratio to initial food profit

NAME: democwvmax
DEFINITION: Democracy wave, maximum amplitude in Polity scale points
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the maximum amplitude in Polity scale points for democracy wave.  Because the Polity democracy scale runs from 1-10 (10=most democratic), it would be highly improbable that the amplitude of any wave be more than 5-6 points.

NAME: DEMOCWVDIR
DEFINITION: Democracy wave direction  (-1 down, 0 off, 1 up)

NAME: DEMOCWAVE
DEFINITION: Democracy wave value in Polity scale points

NAME: cultshts
DEFINITION: Cultural region shift on traditional/secular-rational
Parameter Explanation: Cultural shift on the traditional/rational-secular index.  It is an additive factor that represents the average "shift" in the index for traditional/rational-secular for a given cultural region (relative to what would be expected based of level of GDP per capita), as identified in the World Value Survey project.  The initial value is determined from data, but the user could change the value over time to represent cultural convergence or divergence.

NAME: CULTREG
DEFINITION: Cultural region

NAME: waron
DEFINITION: War switch to turn on war option (1=on; 0=off)
Parameter Explanation: A switch that can be used to turn on or off the possibility of war.  A value of 0 turns off war and a value of 1 makes it possible.  It does not, however, make war certain - that will depend on calculations within each dyad of the probability of war and the conversion (via random processes) of such probabilities into actual conventional or nuclear war.

NAME: vehfuncsw
DEFINITION: Vehicle function switch, across forecasting formulations
Parameter Explanation: Vehicle function switch.  The switch controls which of several functions the model uses to compute car and truck sales.  The standard value for it is 4, which results in the use of a function for sales per capita dependent on GDP per capita at purchasing power, the WVS index for survival/self-expression values, and the WVS index for traditional/secular-rational values.

NAME: POP15TO65
DEFINITION: Population, aged 15 to 65

NAME: matpostradd
DEFINITION: Materialism/postmaterialism index addition
Parameter Explanation: Additive factor to introduce a shift in Materialism/post-materialism index for a region/country.  It increases or decreases the index value that the model calculates.  The normal value is zero.  See also and contrast with cultshmp, which is a cultural shift for the large cultural regions identified in the WVS project and which is calculated from data.

NAME: femshrgr
DEFINITION: Female share of the labor force, annual growth rate
Parameter Explanation: Annual growth rate of the female share in the labor force, expressed in percentage terms.

NAME: wmigrm
DEFINITION: World migration rate multiplier
Parameter Explanation: World migration rate multiplier.  This is a very useful parameter for increasing or decreasing migration rates globally, because it applies to all rates rather than just to those for a particular country or region (for control by country/region see migrater).  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying variable and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: ECONFREE
DEFINITION: Economic freedom, Fraser Institute/Econ Freedom Network freedom indicator (higher more free)

NAME: NSPQLI
DEFINITION: North-South PQLI ratio

NAME: NWAR
DEFINITION: Nuclear war (0=no;1=yes)

NAME: nwarf
DEFINITION: Nuclear war, liklihood of conventional war escalation
Parameter Explanation: Nuclear war factor.  This is a reactivity parameter that relates the severity of a conventional war to the probability that nuclear war will erupt between acting and reacting alliances.  A value of 0 eliminates the possibility of nuclear war; a value of 1 creates a probability of war equal to the severity of conventional war (see cwarf).  By setting the value equal to 100 or more you can force the model to generate a war whenever a conventional war erupts.

NAME: NWARPB
DEFINITION: Nuclear war probability

NAME: wpdemmin
DEFINITION: World politics, response of dispute threat to minimum democracy level in dyad
Parameter Explanation: World politics, response of dispute threat to minimum democracy level in dyad.  The value is in percent probability of a dispute and is applied to the democracy level in the less democratic state in a dyad.  That is, -0.01 would indicate that every point of additional democracy on the underlying Polity scale would reduce the probability of a dispute between two states by 0.01%, all else being equal.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: WPOP
DEFINITION: World population

NAME: WPOPR
DEFINITION: World population annual growth rate

NAME: wppowtran1
DEFINITION: World politics, ratio of power where transition begins
Parameter Explanation: World politics, ratio of power where transition begins.  If the value were 0.7 it would indicate that when the weaker power in a dyad reached 0.7 (or 70%) of the power of the stronger, a power transition would begin.

NAME: XRESERVES
DEFINITION: Reserves of international financial exchange

NAME: XPORTFOLIO
DEFINITION: International portfolio investment, inward stocks, billion currency

NAME: hdilifemax
DEFINITION: Life expectancy maximum for HDI calculation
Parameter Explanation: Life expectancy minimum for PQLI calculation, in years.  Users will normally not change the parameter.

NAME: hivmdcm
DEFINITION: HIV infection rate maximum for MDCs, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the HIV epidemic advance rates, expressed in percentage terms.

NAME: XIMFCRFIN
DEFINITION: Credits from the IMF, annual inflows

NAME: XIMFCRFOUT
DEFINITION: Credits from the IMF, annual outflows (repayments)

NAME: XWBLNFIN
DEFINITION: Loans from the World Bank, annual inflows

NAME: EDTERGRATE
DEFINITION: Education, tertiary, graduation rate

NAME: mhwag
DEFINITION: iMport propensity, agriculture, historical (inertial) delay in change
Parameter Explanation: iMport propensity, historical (inertial) delay in change.  Values near 1.0 imply very rapid adjustment and values near 0 imply little or no adjustment.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: edprisurtrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Primary, Survival Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve 100% Survival Rate in primary education.

NAME: edseclowrtrantrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Sec Lower, Transition Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal transition rate from primary to lower secondary education.

NAME: edsecupprtrantrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Sec Upper, Transition Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve universal transition rate from primary to upper secondary education.

NAME: EDYRSSLE
DEFINITION: Education, school life expectancy, number of expected years of schooling for an elementary entrant

NAME: edseclowrgratrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Sec Lower, Graduation Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve 100% Graduation rate from primary to lower secondary education.

NAME: edsecupprgratrgtyr
DEFINITION: Education, Sec Upper, Graduation Rate, Target Year (number of years from base year to reach 100%)
Parameter Explanation: Parameter for the number of years taken to achieve 100% Graduation rate from primary to upper secondary education.

NAME: POVCOUNT
DEFINITION: Poverty head count, by age-sex, based on income per person of $2.15/day ($2017 PPP)

NAME: POVRATE
DEFINITION: Poverty rate as a percentage of age-sex population, based on income per person of $2.15/day ($2017 PPP)

NAME: EDTERTOT
DEFINITION: Education, tertiary, total students

NAME: GDSED
DEFINITION: Government expenditures on education by level, portion of total govt expenditure in education

NAME: mfpadd
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity growth additive factor
Parameter Explanation: Additive factor on Multifactor Productivity Growth.  This parameter is a powerful mechanism by which the user can increase or decrease the growth rate of countries around assumptions of the rate of productivity growth.  Normally values would be 0.0.  A value of 0.01 would introduce an added productivity growth of 1.0% annually.

NAME: mfpconv
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity growth, convergence time to global function
Parameter Explanation: Convergence of Multifactor Productivity Growth represents the time (in years) for productivity to converge to the global function.

NAME: MFPRATE
DEFINITION: Multifactor productivity rate, computed sectoral

NAME: termtrm
DEFINITION: Terms of trade multiplier (higher is better for South)
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on terms of trade.  The default value of this parameter is 1.0, signifying no exogenous shift in the terms of trade between more and less economically developed countries.  Relative prices in various sectors, particularly agriculture and energy, will still change endogenously.  A value greater than 1.0 additionally improves terms of trade for LDCs at the expense of developed countries.  A value of less than 1.0 shifts terms of trade to the benefit of wealthier countries.  A value of 1.2 would improve the terms of trade of the very least developed countries by about 20 percent.  This parameter should not normally be changed from 1 in the initial year.  Values should generally range from .5 to 1.5.

NAME: TERMTR
DEFINITION: Terms of trade, computed (higher is better for South)

NAME: TFR
DEFINITION: Total fertility rate (births per woman over lifetime)

NAME: WCLPC
DEFINITION: World calories per capita

NAME: WCPOW
DEFINITION: World conventional power

NAME: ylmax
DEFINITION: Yields (agricultural), maximum possible
Parameter Explanation: Maximum yield, by region specifies  the maximum crop yield per hectare (in metric tons) that a region can ever expect to attain in agriculture.

NAME: ZS
DEFINITION: Z (Gross) production by sector

NAME: cultshtsload
DEFINITION: Cultural region shift on traditional/secular-rational load
Parameter Explanation: Cultural region shift on traditional/secular-rational load.  This parameter is computed and used in the "pre-processor" of the model and NOT used in the model itself. Therefore changes by the user will have no effect on the model.

NAME: SURVSELD
DEFINITION: Survival/self-expression index load

NAME: TRADSRATLD
DEFINITION: Traditional/secular-rational load

NAME: HIVRATE
DEFINITION: HIV infection, rate, percentage of adult population

NAME: AIDSDTHS
DEFINITION: AIDS deaths, millions

NAME: INFRAELECACCRURALCOST
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access , rural, cost of a new connection (including transmission and distribution)

NAME: infraelecaccruralcostlower
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access, rural, cost of a new connection, global lower bound

NAME: infraelecaccruralcostm
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access, rural, multiplier on cost of adding a connection
Parameter Explanation: This parameter can be used to change the unit cost for a particular country or region relative to the base case.

NAME: infraelecaccruralcostupper
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, electricity access, rural, cost of a new connection, global upper bound

NAME: AQUACUL
DEFINITION: Aquaculture fish production
Parameter Explanation: Aquaculture, in million metric tons, by region.  Users can provide assumptions over time about domestic fish production with this parameter.

NAME: FDEM
DEFINITION: Food demand

NAME: FEDDEM
DEFINITION: Feed demand

NAME: INDEM
DEFINITION: Industrial food demand

NAME: CLPC
DEFINITION: Calories per capita available

NAME: hivtadvr
DEFINITION: HIV technical control, annual advance in infection rate reduction
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that specifies the HIV technical advance rate to control spread of infection. This reflects simulation of social and behavioral change.

NAME: HIVCASES
DEFINITION: HIV cases

NAME: hivm
DEFINITION: HIV infection rate of advance, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on HIV infection rate. A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: AIDSDRATE
DEFINITION: AIDS death rate as percent of population
Parameter Explanation: AIDS death rate as % of HIV infection rate.  This refers to the percentage of infected individuals in a population who die in a given year, not to the percentage who ultimately die of AIDS.

NAME: CARFOROTH
DEFINITION: Annual net carbon release from forests and other sources

NAME: hivincr
DEFINITION: HIV infection rate, annual increase rate during historic period
Parameter Explanation: Annual increase in the HIV infection rate during historic period, expressed in percentage terms. A value of 8 means an annual increase rate of 8% and these values are only used in the period prior to 2000.

NAME: SFINTLWARMAG
DEFINITION: State failure through internal war, magnitude

NAME: SFINTLWARALL
DEFINITION: State failure through internal war, event occurrence

NAME: SFINSTABMAG
DEFINITION: State failure through instability (abrupt regime transition), magnitude

NAME: SFINSTABALL
DEFINITION: State failure through instability (abrupt regime transition), event occurrence

NAME: wpgreatlev
DEFINITION: World politics, systemic power share required for full great power status
Parameter Explanation: World politics, systemic power share required for full great power status.  The value is in percent of systemic power.  Thus 5.0 would indicate that a state reached the status of full great power when its share of total global power reached 5.0%.  See also the threshold for beginning to be a great power, wpgreatlev.

NAME: HHINC
DEFINITION: Household income, by skill level

NAME: wpthrconv
DEFINITION: World politics, convergence time to predicted underlying threat levels
Parameter Explanation: World politics, convergence time to predicted underlying threat levels.  Very often initial data values for countries, such as dyadic conflict in this case, will differ a little or much from values predicted by broader empirical analysis across states (and possibly across time).  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or idiosyncratic factors.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will very often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country- or dyad-specific "shift" should disappear.  A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.  It is possible to set this parameter to 1, thereby replacing the empirical value by predicted values already in the first year and then every year thereafter.

NAME: HLDIABIGT
DEFINITION: Impared Glucose Tolerance (Precursor to Diabetes)

NAME: HLDIABPREV
DEFINITION: Diabetes Prevalence

NAME: HLDALY
DEFINITION: Disability adjusted life years lost

NAME: ictbroadtechighrt
DEFINITION: Maximum Growth in Technological factor for Broadband Internet Access.

NAME: EDSECENRN
DEFINITION: Education, secondary, net enrollment (% of age group)

NAME: gdsedm
DEFINITION: Government expenditures on education by level, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government expenditure on education by level.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase the underlying value and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, user should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: SANITATIONDEM
DEFINITION: Sanitation, improved, percent of population with access to, demand

NAME: EDYRSAG25
DEFINITION: Education, years obtained by population 25+

NAME: terdispute
DEFINITION: Territorial dispute or absence (1=dispute)
Parameter Explanation: Territorial dispute or absence (1=dispute; 0=no dispute).  This is a dyadic value, between two countries or regions.  The user could change it from 1 to 0 at some point in time to indicate the resolution of dispute.  The initial values reflect actual disputes in the early 21st century.

NAME: wpterdisp
DEFINITION: World politics, increase in militarized dispute prob with territorial dispute
Parameter Explanation: World politics, increase in militarized dispute probability with territorial dispute. The value is in percent. Thus 5.0 would indicate that the probability of a dispute between two states would rise by 5.0% if they have a territorial dispute outstanding, relative to the same pair without such a dispute.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: wppowtran2
DEFINITION: World politics, increase in dispute probability with 10% greater power parity
Parameter Explanation: World politics, increase in dispute probability with 10% greater power parity.  The value is in percent. Thus 0.05 would indicate that the probability of a dispute between two states would rise by 0.05% for each 10% reduction in the power differential between them (or a reduction of 0.1 on a ratio scale).  See also the threshold for the beginning of a power transition, wppowtran1.  Note that this results in a value added to or subtracted from other terms in the calculation of dispute probability (it is not used multiplicatively so as to change an otherwise calculated probability by x%).

NAME: govregqualm
DEFINITION: Government regulatory quality multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on government regulatory quality index.

NAME: THREATSENT
DEFINITION: Threat (sent) index as probability (percent) of militarized dispute, across all targets

NAME: THREATREC
DEFINITION: Threat (received) index as probability (percent) of militarized dispute, across all originators

NAME: GDPPOT
DEFINITION: Gross domestic product potential

NAME: FORSAV
DEFINITION: Foreign savings

NAME: XGOVTDEBTB
DEFINITION: eXternal government debt basic (not private, guaranteed debt or IFI debt ), total

NAME: XGOVTDEBTBF
DEFINITION: eXternal govt debt, basic, change (not private or IFI debt ), total

NAME: sfusehist
DEFINITION: State failure, switch to use history for base values (0=off; 1=on; 2=converge)
Parameter Explanation: Switch to use history for base values of state failure. A value of 0 indicates off; 1 indicates on and 2 indicates convergence.

NAME: XPORTSTOUT
DEFINITION: International portfolio investment (bonds and stocks), outward stocks, billion currency

NAME: XPORTFIN
DEFINITION: International portfolio investment (bonds and stocks), inward flows, billion currency

NAME: XIMFCREDITTOT
DEFINITION: Total credits extended by the IMF

NAME: XWBSUBF
DEFINITION: Subscriptions to the World Bank, annual new flows

NAME: xwblnrepr
DEFINITION: World Bank loan repayment rate/time
Parameter Explanation: World Bank Loan Repayment Rate/Time.

NAME: xwblnintr
DEFINITION: World Bank loan interest rate
Parameter Explanation: World Bank Interest Rate.

NAME: xwblneqr
DEFINITION: World Bank loan to equity ratio
Parameter Explanation: World Bank loan to Equity Ratio.

NAME: INFRATELE
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, telephone network density, Line per 100

NAME: infratelem
DEFINITION: Telephone network density, multiplier

NAME: aidsdratem
DEFINITION: AIDS death rate as percent of HIV infection rate, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on AIDS death rate as a percentage of HIV infection rate. It refers to the percentage of infected individuals in a population who die in a given year, not to the percentage who ultimately die of AIDS.

NAME: aidsdrtadvr
DEFINITION: AIDS death rate, technical annual advance rate in control
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that specifies the technical advance rate in control of deaths from those with AIDS. For example, anti-viral therapies.

NAME: carannwi
DEFINITION: Net emissions from fossil fuels, initial
Parameter Explanation: This parameter sets the initial net emissions from fossil fuels.

NAME: GINIFULL
DEFINITION: Global GINI index of inequality across states and households (larger is more unequal, from 0 to 1)

NAME: sfconv
DEFINITION: State failure, convergence time to expected value
Parameter Explanation: Parameter that determines the convergence time of state failure to its expected value. Very often initial data values for countries will differ a little or much from values predicted by a cross-sectional relationship.  It is never certain whether such differences involve data errors or factors idiosyncratic to countries.  A paradigmatic assumption of IFs is that, over time, values for such variables will often gradually converge to the values predicted by the function and the initial country-specific "shift" should disappear. A high value such as 10000 will effectively turn off the convergence process altogether, while a low value such as 10 will make it very rapid.

Parameter Explanation: Switch to activate linkage between SAM and Malnutrition. A value of 1 indicates on, setting averted SAM cases to malnourished (instead of fully healthy).

NAME: POVGAPNPL

NAME: POVGNDRATIONPL
DEFINITION: Poverty gender ratio, female rate by male rate,  by age-sex, using base year national poverty line

NAME: POVRATENPL
DEFINITION: Poverty rate as a percentage of age-sex population, based on base year national poverty line

NAME: POVSHORTNPL
DEFINITION: Poverty, amount needed to eliminate poverty below base year national poverty line

NAME: POVSHORTSEXDIFFNPL
DEFINITION: Poverty, gender difference in amount needed to eliminate poverty below national poverty line, femal minus male

NAME: povnational
DEFINITION: Poverty, national poverty line, income threshold per person per day, 2011 PPP$

NAME: lvherdm
DEFINITION: Livestock herd multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on livestock herd.

NAME: gdscnstsw
DEFINITION: Government expenditures by destination  switch to keep constant
Parameter Explanation: Government expenditures by destination  switch to keep constant.  A value of 1 implies switch is on, meaning GDS%GDP should be kept constant over time.

NAME: ginidomcnstsw
DEFINITION: Domestic Gini Switch to keep constant (1 is on, and it can start at any year)
Parameter Explanation: Domestic Gini Index constant switch.  Values of 0 turn off and allow endogenous computation; 1 starts the consant period with the last saved value.

NAME: enpadd
DEFINITION: Energy production additive factor
Parameter Explanation: Energy production additive factor.  An additve factor on all types of energy production, unit-less, by region.  A value of 0 implies no change, while positive values proportionately increase production and negative values decrease it.  Warning: no cost to increased production; see ENINVM and ENINVTM for parameters to shift investment and production with trade-offs.

NAME: eninvadd
DEFINITION: Energy investment additive factor
Parameter Explanation: Energy investment additive factor.  An additive factor on energy investment, in Billion $, by region.  A value of 0 implies no change, while positive values increase investment and negative values decrease it.

NAME: edprienrm
DEFINITION: Education, primary, enrollment rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on primary enrollment rate. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1. (Note: Intake and survival rate parameters can also be used to bring in enrollment changes. This parameter affects all but the first grade)

NAME: edseclowrenrm
DEFINITION: Education, lower secondary, enrollment rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on lower secondary enrollment rate. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1. (Note: Transition and graduation rate parameters can also be used to bring in enrollment change. This parameter affects all but the first grade)

NAME: edsecupprenrm
DEFINITION: Education, upper secondary, enrollment rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on upper secondary enrollment rate. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1. (Note: Transition and graduation rate parameters can also be used to bring in enrollment change. This parameter affects all but the first grade)

NAME: edprienrgrdm
DEFINITION: Education, primary, grade-specific enrollment rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on a specific grade enrollment rate in primary. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1.

NAME: edseclowrenrgrdm
DEFINITION: Education, lower secondary, grade-specific enrollment rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on a specific grade enrollment rate in lower secondary. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1.

NAME: edpridrpgrdm
DEFINITION: Education, primary, grade-specific dropout rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on a specific grade dropout rate in primary. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1.

NAME: edseclowrdrpgrdm
DEFINITION: Education, lower secondary, grade-specific dropout rate, multiplier base 1
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier applied directly on a specific grade dropout rate in lower secondary. Values greater (less) than 1 results in growth (decline) from the base level forecast when the multiplier value is 1.

NAME: ennoprodsw
DEFINITION: Energy no production switch (1 turns off production of energy)
Parameter Explanation: Energy no production switch (1 turns off production of energy)

NAME: sfintlwaralltoginidom
DEFINITION: Conflict to Gini multiplier (Base equals 1)
Parameter Explanation: This parameter serves as a multiplier that adjusts the Gini coefficient based on the probability of conflict. It amplifies the Gini index by the set multiplier amount in response to the likelihood of conflict. For example, a multiplier of 1.02 typically suggests a 2% increase in the Gini coefficient. However, the actual increase is adjusted by the probability of conflict; thus, with a 50% probability of conflict, the Gini coefficient would only increase by 1%.

NAME: waterhhsafetrgtyr
DEFINITION: Water Services, Safely Managed, years from model base year to reach the target value of waterhhsafetrgtval
Parameter Explanation: Water Services, Safely Managed, years from model base year to reach the target value stored in the parameter waterhhsafetrgtval. The year count starts from the initial year of the mdoel.

NAME: sanithhmodel2sw
DEFINITION: Infrastructure, water and Sanitation 5 Category Switch, 1 will use 5 category for infrastructure spending and forward linkage
Parameter Explanation: Sanitation Model Switch, Value of 1 Switches to the Regression Model with No Poverty

Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on Polyarchy Index

NAME: democpolyarchyadd

Parameter Explanation: Additive factor to the Polyarchy Index.

NAME: ksm
DEFINITION: Multiplier on KS, by sector, lags 1 yr
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier on capital stocks. This parameter is primarily used to represent destruction of capital stocks due to conflict in a scenario. Care must be used with positive values to avoid increasing capital stocks without accounting for the associated trade-offs.

NAME: inputenerm
DEFINITION: Energy input in the economy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Energy input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of energy as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: inputagrim
DEFINITION: Agricultural input in the economy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Agricultural input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of agricultural products as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: inputictm
DEFINITION: ICT input in the economy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: ICT input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of ICT as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: inputmanum
DEFINITION: Manufacture input in the economy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Manufacture input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of manufactured good as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: inputmatem
DEFINITION: Material input in the economy, multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Material input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of materials as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: inputservm

Parameter Explanation: Service input multiplier.  A multiplier on the use of service as inputs in all economic sectors, unit-less, by region.  A value of 1 implies no change, while higher values proportionately increase material input and lower values decrease it.  Like other multipliers, you should generally not change the value in the initial year because that would override empirical initial conditions; rather you should ramp up or down the multiplier value over time.

NAME: sfcivilwarucdpsw
DEFINITION: State failure/internal war UCDEP switch (1 is on)
Parameter Explanation: State failure/internal war UCDP switch .   When the swithc is 1 the variable SFCIVILWARUCDP will be connected to forward linkagess and parameters, otherwise variable SFINTLWARALL will be used.

NAME: renewtoenexsw
DEFINITION: Renewable Energy Reduction In Exports Switch

NAME: qevremul
DEFINITION: Energy, VRE cost increase multiplier
Parameter Explanation: Multiplier to impact the VRE cost increase as VRE share goes above threshold. A value of 1 means no impact. Values above 1 means cost increase. Values below 1 means decrease.

NAME: qevrethr
DEFINITION: Energy, variable renewable energy share at which system integration impact wind and solar cost
Parameter Explanation: A parameter to set the percentage share of VRE in total energy use at which VRE costs (QE) starts to increase.

NAME: elcaput1
DEFINITION: Elasticity of capacity utilization to stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of capacity utilization to stock level.  Elcaput1 and elcaput2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: elcaput2
DEFINITION: Elasticity of capacity utilization to change in stock level
Parameter Explanation: Elasticity of capacity utilization to stock level change.  Elcaput1 and elcaput2 are a pair of adjustment parameters (not true elasticities) that normally have about a 1:2 ratio.  Significant changes in this parameter could destabilize model behavior.

NAME: migminpoplimit
DEFINITION: Once Population reaches this portion of initial population migration out stops
Parameter Explanation: Once Population reaches this portion of initial population migration out stops

NAME: migrateoutr
DEFINITION: Migration rate (outward), percent of population
Parameter Explanation: Outward migration of a population in percent per year.  Because global emigration and immigration must balance, changes in this value for a single country/region may not change migration/population as substantially as the change introduced originally.

NAME: migrateinr
DEFINITION: Migration rate (inward), percent of population
Parameter Explanation: Net migration of a population in percent per year (negative values reflect emigration and positive values reflect immigration).  Because global emigration and immigration must balance, changes in this value for a single country/region may not change migration/population as substantially as the change introduced in migrater.

NAME: mcadjsw
DEFINITION: Import Capacity Adjustment Switch
Parameter Explanation: Switch for import capacity adjustment. When the switch is ON, we adjust Imports based on changes in exports from main partners.

NAME: migrateinadd
DEFINITION: Migration rate inward additive factor
Parameter Explanation: Inward migration of a population in percent per year.  Because global emigration and immigration must balance, changes in this value for a single country/region may not change migration/population as substantially as the change introduced originally.

NAME: migrateoutadd
DEFINITION: Migration rate outward additive factor
Parameter Explanation: Inward migration of a population in percent per year.  Because global emigration and immigration must balance, changes in this value for a single country/region may not change migration/population as substantially as the change introduced originally.
